The explosion injured one soldier and the soldiers reacted with gunfire. The perpetrators managed to escape.

On 30 June 2020, at least two mortar rounds by Al Shabaab militants landed at the Mogadishu stadium neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Wardhigley district (Wardhigley, Banadir). One mortar shell impacted in the stadium and the other landed outside of the stadium at the time of attack, the president was inside of the stadium participating the opening ceremony of Stadium Mogadishu.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: On 29 June 2020, Govt forces and AMISOM forces conducted an operation and clashed with an Al Shabaab militant convoy in the vicinity of Mareerey village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). Al Shabaab militants escaped and Govt forces continued they operations.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: On 29 June 2020, Govt forces and AMISOM forces conducted an operation and clashed with Al Shabaab militants at a checkpoint in Mukudheere village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). After an exchange of gunfire from both sides, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area. Govt forces arrested several people suspected to be Al Shabaab militants.

On 29 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out a hit and run attack against a Govt forces (military) checkpoint in Indhafiiq neighbourhood of Hawlwadaag in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). Both sides exchange heavy gunfire and Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 29 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Govt security forces (military) checkpoint at Mashalay village (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire and Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 29 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed a civilian vehicle carrying Govt forces (military) near Daynuunay village (Baydhaba, Bay). Al Shabaab militants and Govt soldiers engaged in a brief clash after which the vehicle managed to escape from the militants.

On 28 June 2020, over hundreds of local youths, women and Govt officials staged a peaceful protest at Daljir Dahsoon village in Mogadishu-Bondhere district (Bondhere, Banadir), supporting the decisions of the parliament of giving 13 elective seat to Banadir region to represent in the Upper house. This protest was organized by the local authorities. [size=over hundreds]

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: On 28 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants targeted AMISOM (Djibouti) with six mortar shells in the Qrhasan neighbourhood of Hawlwadaag in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The mortars landed in an open ground north of AMISOM base and no damage of properties were reported.

On 28 June 2020, Govt forces (assumed military) fired three IDF rounds which landed in the ocean near Aden Ade international airport in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir). This is where AU forces base is located.

On 28 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Govt security forces base in Embarreeso village (Baraawe, Lower Shabelle). After heavy exchange of gunfire from both sides, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 28 June 2020, two children were killed and two others injured by a UXO which exploded while they were playing with the ordnance at Aargada village in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). The explosion occurred after the children found a grenade in a garbage bin and was reportedly trying to use a nail to open it.

On 28 June 2020, unknown assailants threw a hand grenade at the Biya-Degeenka checkpoint neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Heliwa district (Heliwa, Banadir). Police at the checkpoint reacted with gunfire after the attack and the perpetrators escaped from the area.

On 27 June 2020, armed militiamen from the Ayr and Saleban clans of Habar Gedir clashed at Qalanqale village near Dhuusamarreeb town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). Six people were killed in the clash and twenty others injured. The clash was related to a land dispute and ongoing clan revenge.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: On 27 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Jubaland forces base in the vicinity of Dhobley town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). After an exchange of heavy weapons, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 27 June 2020, an IED hidden by the roadside targeting Govt forces (assumed military) prematurely detonated in Arafat village neighborhood in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). One civilian bystander was injured by the blast and the perpetrators managed to escape after explosion.

On 27 June 2020, an armed clash was reported between a Husen Sub-Clan militia and Reer Garaad Sub-Clan militia, both from the Warsengeli clan, in Cawsane village (Laasqoray, Sanaag). The motive of the clash is believed to be land disputes including pasturelands and water resources. At least six people were injured in the clan clash.

On 27 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants armed with pistols shot and seriously injured a Govt soldier at Tabeelaha-Weydow village in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The perpetrators managed to escape.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: On 27 June 2020, Jubaland forces and Danab conducted joint security operations against Al Shabaab militants stronghold of Jana Cabdalle town and nearby Helishid and Mayonde villages (Kismaayo,Lower Juba). After exchange of gunfire, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area and Govt forces retook the villages.

On 27 June 2020, the reconciliation process between two sub-clans Reer Hagar and Hayaag both belonging to the Dhulbahante main clan was finalized in Buuhoodle town (Buuhoodle,Togdheer). Twenty Clan elders from Hayaag and twenty others from Reer Hagar engineered the agreement and both parties committed themselves to abide by the peace agreement.

On 27 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed two municipal police officers and injured another in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir). The police collecting taxes from trucks in the location and perpetrators managed to escape from the location.

On 26 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Govt forces (Danab and Gor Gor) in the vicinity of Mubaarak village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab checkpoints were destroyed following the clash.

On 26 June 2020, security forces (Danab and Gor Gor) attacked an Al Shabaab checkpoint between Yuumbis, Buulo-bashiir and Tortoroow village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). After an exchange of heavy weapons, both sides retreated from the area.
On 26 June 2020, Govt forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants during an operation in Duqay village (Baardheere, Gedo). Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area following the clash.

On 26 June 2020, Govt forces (Danab and Gor Gor) clashed with Al Shabaab militants during an operation near Shaam village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area following the clash.
On 26 June 2020, Govt forces clashed with Al Shabaab militants in the vicinity of Buur Gaduud village (Saakow, Middle Juba). One Al Shabaab militant was killed and several others were injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: On 26 June 2020, two groups of Puntland security forces fought over control of Badhan airstrip in Badhan town (Laasqoray, Sanaag). The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire, one soldier was killed and traditional elders made efforts to persuade the warring parties observe an immediate ceasefire.

On 25 June 2020, armed militia men from the Ayr and Saleban sub-clans of Habar Gedir clashed at Xananbuuro village (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). Five people were killed, including a former Galmudug minister who was mediating between the militias. Clash was related to a land dispute and ongoing clan revenge.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: On 25 June 2020, an Al Shabaab RICIED targeted an AMISOM convoy travelling on the road between an AMISOM base and Mahadaay town (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). The explosion missed the target.

On 25 June 2020, three Al Shabaab were killed including foreign senior trainer of the militant during a joint operation by Govt forces and allied forces (Ethiopia forces) between Sakow and Salagle town (Saakow, Middle Juba).

On 25 June 2020, an Al Shabaab roadside IED targeted a police forces vehicle travelling on the road between Aargada Daynile and Afgooye, in the Haanta Dheer neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir).

On 25 June 2020, bodyguards (police) of Buloburte district commissionaires exchanged fire with each other in downtown Bulo Burto town (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). Govt forces (military) intervened and order was restored.

On 25 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants amputated the right hand of two civilians in a public gathering at Galcad village (Ceel Dheer, Galgaduud). After an Al Shabaab court accused them of stealing money from shops in the town.

On 25 June 2020, a male journalist was shot and injured by a Govt soldier (military) manning a security checkpoint in the Seybiano neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan,Banadir). The victim was reportedly rushed to hospital for treatment.

On 24 June 2020, taxi drivers staged a peaceful protest against the local authorities over poor roads in Guri-Ceel town (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud). The drivers stopped working and demanded the rehabilitation of the roads and vowed not to pay their taxes. [size= no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: On 24 June 2020, Jubaland forces and Danab conducted a security operation and clashed with Al Shabaab militants in the vicinity of Bar-Sanguun village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Two Al Shabaab militants were killed in the operation.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: On 24 June 2020, Jubaland forces and Danab conducted a security operation and clashed with Al Shabaab militants near Jamaame town (Jamaame, Lower Juba). Three Al Shabaab militants were killed in the operation.
On 24 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants carried out an attack on a Govt security forces (military) base at Mareerey village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). Two people were killed in the clash.

On 24 June 2020, a suspected AS militant threw a hand grenade at a Govt security forces (Military) checkpoint in Lafoole village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The soldiers manning the checkpoint reacted with gunfire. One civilian bystander was injured by the blast.

On 24 June 2020, a Govt soldier shot and killed a female passenger on a tuktuk in the milk factory village neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The soldier opened gunfire at the tuktuk after the driver refused to stop. The perpetrator managed to escape.
On 23 June 2020, unknown gun men shot and killed a civilian youth in Hawo-Cabdi village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle).

On 23 June 2020, suspected Govt soldiers shot and killed a civilian man in the Raadeerka village neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). Soldiers opened fire after the man, who was deaf, failed to stop when instructed.

On 23 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants executed two Govt soldiers at a public gathering in Buulo Fulaay village (Buur Hakaba, Bay). The victims were captured and detained by Al Shabaab several months ago after they arrived in Al Shabaab controlled areas claiming to have defected from Govt forces (Southwest State forces).

On 23 June 2020, a delegation, led by the regional governor heading to Feer-Feer village were attacked by Ujejeen clan militias at Jawiil village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The delegation bodyguards (assumed military) exchanged small arms fire with the militia.

On 23 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants hijacked three civilian vehicles between Afmadow and Bilis Qooqaani town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). Al Shabaab instructed all the passengers to drop down on the ground and the vehicles were taken to an unknown destination.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)

On 23 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt security officer in the vicinity of Hawo-Cabdi village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The perpetrators managed to escape and police attended the scene but no arrests were made.

On 23 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants executed a Hawadle clan civilian in a public gathering at Booco village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan), after an Al Shabaab court sentenced him to a death penalty for practising witchcraft in their controlled area.

A security guard tried to stop the perpetrator, shooting and injuring the bomber before the vest exploded, killing him and two other people.
On 22 June 2020, an Al Shabaab RCIED detonated in Camaara village (Hobyo, Mudug). The IED was hidden at tea shop which regularly used by Govt soldiers.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: On 22 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants fired mortars at the AMISOM (Ethiopia) base in Halgan village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). AMISOM responded to the shelling with heavy weapon fire.

On 22 June 2020, Govt security forces (Gor-Gor and Danab military) attacked an Al Shabaab base in Gendershe town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). One Al Shabaab militant was killed in the attack. Govt forces retreated from the area following the clash.

On 22 June 2020, Govt security forces (Gor-Gor and Danab Military) attacked an Al Shabaab base in Jilib-Marca town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). One Al Shabaab militant was killed in the attack. Govt forces retreated from the area following the clash.

On 22 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants detonated an IED at the Buloburto district airstrip in Bulo Burto town (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). Several people were injured and it destroyed the roof of the passenger waiting area.

On 22 June 2020, about 50 youths whose application to join the NISA training was turned down protested against the decision in Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The local elders intervened and reconciled with the protesters. [size=about 50]

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force

On 22 June 2020, security forces (Danab) brigade took over control of Dhanaane village (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Five Al Shabaab militants were killed in an exchange of light gunfire and Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 21 June 2020, a group of demonstrators turned violent in the city and vandalised glass windows of shops, vehicles, burnt tires and blocked the main road of Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The demonstration was linked to security forces personnel activities in the town. [size= no report]

On 21 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Govt security forces checkpoint at Cumar Beere village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). After exchange of gunfire, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 21 June 2020, Govt security forces attacked an Al Shabaab base at Dug-wariiri village in the vicinity of Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Govt forces claim to have killed 29 militants including two senior members.

On 21 June 2020, a Somali military officer's house was attacked with two suspected hand grenades in the Waberi village neighbourhood of Wanla Weyne town (Wanla Weyne, Lower Shabelle). Five civilians were killed in the attack. The identity of the attackers was not reported.

On 21 June 2020, an Al Shabaab car bomb exploded at a military checkpoint near a police station in Baad Weyne village (Hobyo, Mudug). Three soldiers were killed and more than five people, including soldiers and civilians, were injured.

On 21 June 2020, a Leelkayse clan militia clashed with a Majeerten clan militia in the Deeralay area near Beyra Village (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). One person was killed and three others injured in the clash. Clash was related to a water and land dispute.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: On 20 June 2020, local residents protested against the regional office and the office of Minister of Interior in Laag village (Bossaso, Bari) over recent appointments. The police shot at and beat protesters. One person was killed and several others injured. [size=at least several]

On 20 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants launched an attack against a Govt military convoy in the vicinity of Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab militants displayed five bodies of Govt soldiers following the clash.

On 20 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a senior Govt soldier in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). The officer was monitoring other soldiers at checkpoints within the area. The perpetrators escaped with his gun.
On 20 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a young man accused of spying for Govt soldiers in Galhareeri village (Ceel Buur, Galgaduud). He was killed in a public squre in the village.

On 20 June 2020, a Govt soldier shot and killed a civilian motor van driver in the Afgooye area of Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). The perpetrator escaped after the scene. The motive of the incident is unknown.

On 19 June 2020, at least four Al Shabaab IEDs targeting an Ethiopian troop (Non-Amisom) convoy exploded near Urkur village (Luuq, Gedo). Al Shabaab claim that the explosion killed four soldiers and damaged a military vehicle.

notes: On 19 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a Govt forces/AMISOM (Uganda) base in Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle).

On 19 June 2020, around hundreds of residents protested new changes by local authorities in Bosaso town, by block the main roads in Lanta Hawada village (Bossaso, Bari). The protest was prompted by local authories appointing new officers from one clan only. [size=around hundreds]

On 19 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants abducted two male civilians, one confirmed to be a foreign national doctor (Kenyan) and the other a civilian businessman, near Liboi town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). The doctor and the businessman were going to Dhobley town. The exact motive behind the abduction remains unclear.

On 19 June 2020, ENDF soldiers (Non-Amisom) opened fire and injured four civilians near Bashiiro village (Luuq,Gedo). The incident happened after the civilians ran away from the soldiers who were part of the ENDF convoy.

On 19 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed a civilian vehicle carrying mira/khat in Yasooman village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). The driver and assistant driver survived the attack and no casualties were reported.

On 18 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt soldier in Musse Geel village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). The officer was at checkponit when he was killed and the perpetrators escaped with the weapons of the victim.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: On 18 June 2020, Jubaland security forces exchanged fire with about three Al Shabaab militants near the forward operation base between Yoontoy and Bula Gaduud village (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). Al Shabaab militants retreated, leaving behind IED components.

On 18 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Macaswiley militia-controlled areas in Yaaq Biri Weyne and Kaba Hereg villages (Wanla Weyn, Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab militants abducted and later killed four people. Fatalities split between two events.

On 18 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked Macaswiley militia-controlled areas in Yaaq Biri Weyne and Kaba Hereg villages (Wanla Weyn, Lower Shabelle). Al Shabaab militants abducted and later killed four people. Fatalities split between two events.

On 18 June 2020, a remote controlled IED targeted a former SNA deputy commander-in-chief in the Ex-Abdi-Kasim state house neighbourhood Taleh village in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The commander's vehicle passed the point before the IED exploded, the blast hit a tuk-tuk and three civilians were killed in the attack.

On 18 June 2020, an armed man from Habar-Jeclo Bicido sub-clan opened fire on a rented vehicle carrying an INGO team travelling through Laas Doomaare village (Ceel Afweyn, Sanaag). The attack is believed to be related to dissatisfaction over the distribution of aid services and beneficiary registration.

On 18 June 2020, an IED prematurely detonated during its preparation by Al Shabaab militants at Buur Dhuxunle village (Rab Dhuure, Bakool). One Al Shabaab bomb maker was confirmed dead in the explosion.
On 18 June 2020, Al Shabaab militant shot and killed a Govt soldier at Suuqa-xolaha village in Mogadishu-Heliwa district (Heliwa, Banadir). The perpetrators escaped.

On 18 June 2020, two armed militias from the Ayr sub clan of Habargidir clan exchanged gunfire at Ilix village (Dhuusamarreb,Galgaduud). The incident was the result of a land dispute and the police forces arrested one perpetrator following the clash.

On 18 June 2020, Banadir police conducted an operation and clashed with Al Shabaab militants at their house in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). After exchange of gunfire from both side, a senior Al Shabaab militant was arrested.

On 18 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a police officer at Bakara market junction in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The police was on duty at the junction and was shot by two Al Shabaab militants who escaped from the scene.

On 18 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants raided a children's home and kidnapped several children in Dhobely town (Afmadow, Lower Juba). The militants struck in the wee hours of the morning when the children were asleep.

On 17 June 2020, Govt forces (military) carried out an operations against Al Shabaab and after heavy clash, the forces captured Warxoolo village (Ceel Buur, Galgaduud). Al Shabaab militants retreated from the village.

On 17 June 2020, residents protested against the committee for the preparedness and response of coronavirus over the mishandling of dead bodies in Heedho village (Hargeysa, Woqooyi Galbeed). They reiterated that the committee should be held liable for the cremation and dumping of suspected coronavirus dead bodies in a dry river in the village. [size=no report]
On 17 June 2020, police and military forces clashed in Jowhar town (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). Three people were killed in the clash. The clash related to a land dispute between members of the groups.

On 17 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants hurled a hand-grenade at Govt police officers on foot patrol in the Arafat village neighborhood in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir). Police forces reacted with heavy gunfire and the perpetrators managed to escape.

On 17 June 2020, Reer Aw Hassan clan militia shot and killed a father and his son from the Hawadle clan in Burukur village near Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The motive behind the killing is related to clan retaliation.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: On 17 June 2020, an Al Shabaab IED targeting a Govt forces/US forces convoy exploded near Leego village (Buur Hakaba, Bay). One military vehicle was destroyed by the explosion.

On 16 June 2020, Govt forces opened fire on farmers in Abaaleey village near Feerfeer town (Balet Weyne, Hiraan). Five civilians were killed and several others injured in the attack.

On 16 June 2020, protestors took to the streets exhibiting their support for Somaliland president speech during the Somalia and Somaliland consultative summit in Caynabo town (Caynabo, Sool). The speech stated that Somalia and the international community should recognize Somaliland's sovereignty and Independence. [size= no report]

On 16 June 2020, Govt forces (Military) carried out an operation against an Al Shabaab militant stronghold in Luuqjelow village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). After an exchange of gunfire, Al Shabaab militants retreated from the village and Govt forces released two detainees.

On 16 June 2020, a Reer Aw Hassan clan militia clashed with members of a Hawadle clan militia and attacked their houses in the Darerta area of Mohamud Gacal village near Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). During the face-off, Reer Aw Hassan clan militia were forced to withdraw from the combat zone.

On 16 June 2020, Govt security personnel (assume military) shot and killed a civilian who owned a small business on the side of the road near El-Gabta junction road in Mogadishu-Hamar Jabjab district (Hamar-Jabjab, Banadir). On 15 June 2020, two Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a civilian man working for the Ministry of Finance who was shopping at Jamhuuriya village in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir). The district police attended to the scene, but no arrests was made.

On 15 June 2020, Hawadle clan militia shot and killed a civilian man from the Ujeedeen clan in the outskirts of Jawil village (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). The motive behind the killing was related to clan retaliation and the perpetrator was arrested by the police.

On 15 June 2020, a peaceful protest took place in Buuhoodle town (Buuhoodle, Togdheer). The demonstrators were complaining that they were not represented nor included in the Somalia and Somaliland consultative summit in Djibouti. [size=no report]

On 15 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants shot and killed two civilian men hailing from Makane clan in Warahuubo village near Belet Weyne town (Belet Weyne, Hiraan). Both men were chewing mira/khad in the outskirts of the village which Al Shabaab militants have already prohibited in the areas under their control.

Al Shabaab claim to have killed one soldier, though this could not be confirmed.

On 14 June 2020, Al Shabaab militants ambushed and killed two Govt security personnel riding on a motorbike in the vicinity of Tabeelaha-Weydow village in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). The perpetrators confiscated a AK47 gun owned by one of the victims and managed to escape.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)

On 14 June 2020, a suspected Al Shabaab militants ambushed a public minibus carrying passengers from Afgooye district travelling to Wanlaweyne district at the Buulallow village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The militants robbed the passenger's money and valuable items.

On 28 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a civilian man who worked at the government public roads and infrustructure department at section three neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Kaxda district (Kaxda, Banadir).

On 28 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a clan elder who was among the electoral delegates that selected the current government in the last election and his bodyguard at Suuq-Bacaad neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Yaqshid district (Yaqshid, Banadir).

On 28 May 2020, an UVIED explosion by Al shabaab militants killed two police officers travelling with a private vehicle on the Hooyooyinka road near the national theatre neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Hamar Weyne district (Hamar Weyne, Banadir). Two others were injured.

On 28 May 2020, suspected Govt soldiers (military) abducted and killed eight people, where seven of them were aid workers in a mother child health (MCH) centre run by an NGO in Gololey village (Balcad, Midddle Shabelle). The motive of the killing is unknown.

On 28 May 2020, Al shabaab militants launched a probing attack targeting the Southwest special police forces (SWSPF) base in Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay). After exchange of heavy gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)

On 27 May 2020, Al shabaab militant shot and killed a civilian man in public square in Ceel Buur town (Ceel Buur, Galgaduud). The victim had previously killed another person in the same town.

On 27 May 2020, Govt forces (military) and Southwest Special Police Forces (SWSP) conducted a security operation targeting Al shabaab militants bases near Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay). After heavy exchange of gunfire from both side, two Al shabaab militants were killed in the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force

They were later they dispersed by security forces.

On 27 May 2020, Al shabaab militants abducted the chief of Dhagaxow village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). He was accused of inciting the population to not obey Al shabaab orders and logistic contributions in the area.

On 27 May 2020, two persons riding on a motorcycle were detained at a Al shabaab militant checkpoint near Fiidow town (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). One was shot dead when he tried to escape and the other remained the militant's prison.

On 27 May 2020, an RCIED by Al shabaab militants targeting an Ethiopia military (non-AMISOM) convoy heading to Qansax-Dheere town detonated near Abrano village (Baydhaba, Bay). Al shabaab claimed to have destroyed military vehicles.

On 27 May 2020, Al shabaab militants launched a hit and run attack on Govt forces (military) based at the entrance checkpoint of Bulo Mareer town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After an exchange of heavy gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 27 May 2020, Al shabaab militants killed two people in Ceel-Dheer village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). The victims were accused of beating their wives naked, stating such an act is contrary to the Islamic Sharia law.

On 26 May 2020, Macawisley (Hawadle clan militias) launched a hit and run attack against the Al shabaab militant base in Af cad village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). In the attack two Al shabaab militants were killed and six others suffered injuries.

On 26 May 2020, a man was killed and another wounded by a gunman over a clan dispute in Xarfa village (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The victims and the attacker were from the same sub-clan of Majeerteen-Omar Mohamud. The perpetrator managed to escape from the scene.

On 26 May 2020, two gunmen suspected to be Al shabaab militants, shot, and killed a civilian at the Ceelasha Biyaha settlement (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The district police attended the scene and no arrests were reported. The motive of this assassination is not clear.

On 26 May 2020, an IED by Al shabaab militants targeting a Govt security forces (military) convoy travelling from Jowhar town to Balcad exploded between Ceel Geelow and Gololey village (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). The attack killed seven soldiers and injured three others.

On 26 May 2020, Govt forces (military) conducted an operation against Al shabaab militants between Bulo Burto and Jalalaqsi town. Govt forces killed three Al shabaab militants in Af Cad village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan).

On 26 May 2020, two groups of Govt forces (military) exchanged heavy gun fire at the BECO village neighborhood in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Deynile, Banadir) when one group tried to stop the construction of a new building by a Deyniile district official. Five soldiers were killed in the fight.

On 26 May 2020, two men suspected Al shabaab militants carried out an attack against a police personnel at his home about midnight at Tokiyo village in Mogadishu-Hawl Wadaag district (Hawl Wadaag, Banadir). The police office killed one, while the other one escaped from the area.

On 26 May 2020, a man from Habar Yoonis-Sacad Yoonis clan was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in a village near Oog town (Caynabo, Sool). The motive behind his death is unknown and the perpetrator managed to escape from the area.

On 26 May 2020, an Al shabaab militant killed a civilian man who refused to pay contributions to the militants group in Mukudheere village (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). The deceased individual was allegedly linked to the digging of a well in the village.
On 26 May 2020, Al shabaab militants and the Hawadle clan militias engaged in an armed clash in Raqayda village near Jalalaqsi town (Jalalaqsi, Hiraan).

On 26 May 2020, Govt forces (military) and Hiraan Govt troops conducted a military operation in Aborey village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). The Govt troops (military) took control of the village including all equipment owned by the Al shabaab militants and released 8 prisoners from the militant's jails. Five Al shabaab militants were killed in the attack.
On 26 May 2020, Kenya airforce conducted airstrikes targetting Al shabaab militants in the outskirts of Faafax Dhuun village (Baardheere, Gedo).

On 26 May 2020, Govt forces (military), while on an operation, clashed with Al shabaab militants in Ceel-Bacad village (Bulo Burto, Hiraan). After a heavy exchange of gunfire, five Al shabaab militants were killed and the group retreated from the area.

On 26 May 2020, unidentified armed personnel driving a motorbike shot and killed a tuktuk driver near Tabeelah Weydow in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). The police attended the scene, but no arrests were reported.

On 25 May 2020, Al shabaab militants ambushed and destroyed a motorbike transporting khat/mira near Buul Duuf village in the vicinity of Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). The driver of the motorbike was killed. Militants also abducted the passengers of a motorbike transporting khat/mira, though it is unclear whether this was the same motorbike.

On 25 May 2020, Al shabaab militants launched an attack on a Govt forces (Military) base between Balcad and Warshiikh town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). After exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab killed two Govt soldiers.

On 25 May 2020, a Govt soldier armed shot and killed a male civilian at the Karan vegetable market village in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir). The district police attended the scene, but no arrests were made. The motive for this killing is unknown.

On 25 May 2020, suspected Govt soldiers (assume military) opened gunfire on a public minibus carrying passengers from Afgooye town travelling to Awdheegle village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The driver of the minibus was killed while three passengers on board the minibus were injured. The motive for this shooting is not yet clear.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: On 25 May 2020, US Forces conducted an airstrike targeting Al Shabaab militants in Haawaay village (Sablaale, Lower Shabelle). The strike killed three Al shabaab militants.

On 25 May 2020, an UN chartered commercial flight delivering humanitarian cargo to Qansax Dheere town received at least two bullet shot by suspected state forces during its final approach for landing in Qansax Dheere town (Qansax Dheere, Bay). The aircraft managed to land safely, offloaded the cargo and returned to Mogadishu and two aid workers were arrested and later released.

On 25 May 2020, Al shabaab militants attacked a Govt forces (Military) base camp at Haansheekh village near Balcad town (Balcad, Middle Shabelle). After a brief exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 24 May 2020, Kenya airforce conducted airstrikes targeting Al shabaab militants but the strikes hit civilian pastoralists in a village near El Wak town (Ceel Waaq, Gedo). The strikes injured three civilians.

On 24 May 2020, an RCIED by Al shabaab targeted a vehicle owned by a senior police officer while passing near 21 October junction road neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Waaberi district (Waaberi, Banadir). On 24 May 2020, unidentified armed personnel driving a motorbike shot and killed a tuk-tuk driver near Tabeelah Weydow Mogadishu-Heliwa district (Heliwa, Banadir). The police attended the scene, but no arrests were reported.

On 24 May 2020, an RCIED by Al shabaab exploded targeting a congregation at a traditional dance celebrating Eid in the Banqiyami area of Baidoa town (Baydhaba, Bay). The explosion killed five people and injured thirty others.

On 23 May 2020, a suspected Al shabaab militants carried out a hit and run attack against Govt forces' (Military) in Kabtab Laas (Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle). After heavy exchange of gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 23 May 2020, six persons were wounded after a hand grenade that one of them was holding accidentally detonated at Kabka area in Garsoor section (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The injured were taken to Gaalkacyo hospital for treatment.

On 23 May 2020, a suspected Al-Shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at a Govt security (assume military) checkpoint in the Biya-Degeenka neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Heliwa district (Heliwa, Banadir). The police reacted with gunfire.

On 23 May 2020, a male civilian was shot and injured by custodial corps soldiers (assumed military) in a convoy passing the Israac village neighbourhood of Mogadishu-Hamar Jabjab district (Hamar Jabjab, Banadir). The soldiers suspected his vehicle to be loaded as a VBIED when it drove close to the convoy. The driver was reportedly instructed to stop but did not take heed.
On 23 May 2020, a landmine killed the chairwoman of the Diinsoor women's association in Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Bay). The explosion also injured three of her relatives.

On 23 May 2020, an armed clash was reported between a Saad clan militia and Govt forces (SNA/NISA) in south Gaalkacyo (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The clash was initiated when businessmen from the Saad clan were arrested by Govt forces. Six from the clan militia and Danab forces were killed, along with two civilians. Twelve others were injured.

On 23 May 2020, two mortar rounds likely fired from the village of Tayeegleey by unknown group impacted in the Fiidow area (Jowhar, Middle Shabelle). The mortar slightly injured two children and killed two cows.

On 22 May 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out an attack targeting Govt forces (military) at Qansax Dheere town (Qansax Dheere, Bay). After a brief exchange of gunfire, Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 21 May 2020, Al shabaab militants abducted a father and his son from their home in Diinsoor town. The father was released, while the dead body of the son was found at the Southeastern periphery of Diinsoor town (Diinsoor, Banadir). The motive behind the abduction and killing is yet to be confirmed.

On 21 May 2020, a Govt soldier shot and killed a youth civilian who was coming from a mosque in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir). This act was mistaken identity and the soldier was arrested.
On 21 May 2020, Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at police manning Howlwadag junction in Mogadishu-Hawl Wadaag district (Hawl Wadaag, Banadir). The explosin injured two police officers.
On 21 May 2020, Govt forces clashed with Al shabaab militants collecting tax near Leego village (Buur Hakaba, Bay). The soldiers killed two Al shabaab militant and destroyed their tax base.

On 21 May 2020, Al shabaab militants launched an attack targeting Govt security forces (military) in Buurdhuubo town (Garbahaarey, Gedo). Two militants were killed after brief exchange of small arms fire and Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 21 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt soldier at Lafole Village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Al-Shabab claimed the killing, stating that they targeted the soldier in special operation carried out by their Amniyats.

On 20 May 2020, Al shabaab militants launched an attack on Govt (military) checkpoints located on the outskirts of Awdheegle town (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The clash was initiated with hand grenades and an exchange of heavy gunfire. Al shabaab militants retreated from the area.

On 19 May 2020, Kenya aircrafts fired several rockets targeting Al shabaab militants position near Garsaale village (Ceel Waaq, Gedo). Al shabaab militants vehicles was destroyed by the airstrike.

On 19 May 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out an attack against a Govt forces (assumed military) base in the vicinity of Golweyne town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire and Al shabaab militants were forced to withdraw.

On 18 May 2020, a suspected Al shabaab militant shot and seriously injured a Govt security officer (assumed military) at Ceelasha Biyaha settlement (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The perpetrators managed to escape, the police forces conducted search operation and arrested one suspect.

On 18 May 2020, suspected Al shabaab militants kidnapped two civilian males belonging to the Garikombe sub clan at Gawoow Gabdhoore settlement in the vicinity of Kismayo town (Kismaayo, Lower Juba). The kidnapped were distributing food items which was donated by Somalis from the diaspora.
On 18 May 2020, security forces (Military) backed by Southwest administration forces (Military) killed seven Al shabaab militants in an operation near Aawdiinle village (Baydhaba, Bay).

On 18 May 2020, unidentified gunmen threw a hand grenade at Govt troops (assumed military) at a checkpoint in the Isse Abdi village neighbourhood in Mogadishu-Daynile district (Daynile, Banadir). The forces reacted with gunfire after the explosion.

On 18 May 2020, a hand grenade was hurled at a Govt security forces (military) checkpoint near Buulo Folyo village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). The soldiers reacted with gunfire in the direction of the suspected source of the attack.

On 17 May 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out an attack against a Govt military base located in Mukaiga village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). After exchange of heavy gunfire from both sides, Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 17 May 2020, a suicide bomber detonated an explosive laden tri wheeler at the Governor's office in Gaalkacyo town (Gaalkacyo, Mudug). The explosions killed the governor along with four of his security officers.

On 17 May 2020, an VIED fitted to a vehicle owned by a Govt soldier (assumed military) detonated near Suuq-Boocle Village neighborhood in Mogadishu-Dharkenley district (Dharkenley, Banadir). Al shabaab claimed the responsility of the attack.

On 17 May 2020, a remote controlled IED (RCIED) targeting a toyota pickup carrying police personnel detonated and damaged the vehicle passing near Macalin Nuur alley in Mogadishu-Wadajir district (Wadajir, Banadir).

On 17 May 2020, Al shabaab militants carried out an attack against a Govt forces (military) checkpoint located at Cumar Beerre village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Govt forces responded and Al shabaab militants retreated.

On 14 May 2020, Govt forces (military) attacked an Al shabaab base between Captain-Laas and Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). After a heavy exchange of gunfire, Govt forces claimed to have killed five militants, including one senior leader.

On 14 May 2020, Al shabaab militants threw a hand grenade at Govt forces (assumed military) as they passed through Ceelasha Biyaha village (Afgooye, Lower Shabelle). Al shabaab claimed to have killed two soldiers in the attack and the soldiers reacted with heavy gunfire.

On 13 May 2020, two groups of Govt troops (assumed military) engaged in a confrontation near Kaaran Police Station in Mogadishu-Karan district (Karan, Banadir), with both sides exchanging heavy gunfire. The clash was related to clan revenge between two sub clans of Abgaal clan.

On 9 May 2020, two Al shabaab militants attacked a police officer at Seybiyaano neighborhood in Mogadishu-Hodan district (Hodan, Banadir). The militants shot the police officer but also sustained injuries and when they tried to escape people nearby captured them and handed them over to the police.
On 9 May 2020, Govt forces (assumed military) took control over Qaayib (Dhuusamarreeb, Galgaduud) and Cadakibir villages from Al Shabaab militants. No clash reported.

On 2 May 2020, Al shabaab militants shot and killed a Govt soldier (assumed military) near Mayafulka (Baydhaba, Bay). The victim was heading to the Govt post at Mayafulka when Al shabaab fighters ambushed and killed him on the road and took his weapon.

26 March. Al Shabaab militants executed five men in public by firing squad in Yaq Barawe accused of spying.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: 24 February. In Hiraan Province there was an overnight airstrike targeting AS. No casualties reported so far.
24 February. A government soldier was killed by suspected AS fighters in Daynille.
23 February. A police officer shot and injured a woman in her vehicle for refusing to abide by traffic regulations.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: On 23 February 2019, two civilians were killed due to an air strike by the US military in Kuunyo-Barrow village (Jilib, Middle Juba).
23 February. More than 20 elders have been abducted by suspected AS fighters in Xarardheere.
23 February. In Karan, Mogadishu, one of Somalia's oldest MPs Osman Elmi Boqorre was shot dead by suspected AS fighters.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 23 February. AS fighters were forced to retreat by AMISOM forces after they attacked them with three mortar rounds and gunfire.
23 February. There was a peaceful protest by students of Haji Adan Secondary School, who protested because their Deputy Principal was leaving. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: 23 February. US AFRICOM conducted an overnight air strike targeting AS tax collection checkpoint in Jannale.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: 22 February. AMISOM drawdown begins with 200 out of an expected 1,000 Burundian soldiers from the contingent withdrawing from Somalia. The 21,500 AMISOM troops are planned to be fully withdrawn by end 2020.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 22 February. AS and AMISOM Ethiopian troops clashed after AS attacked the Ethiopians forces from several directions in Bardhere.
22 February. Al Shabaabab forces attacked SNA Forces in Golweyn district. Casualties reported.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 22 February. An AMISOM convoy heading to Jowhar town was damaged due to an IED planted in Qalimow vicinity.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 22 February. In Ceel Geelow, AMISOM forces were targeted by AS's IEDs. No fatalities reported.
22 February. An unidentified man killed a person from the Omar Mohammed clan in Gaalkacyo.
21 February. A tuktuk driver was killed by a police officer in Hodan due to an extortion related issue.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: 21 February. SNA and US forces jointly attacked AS a few km away from Afgoye town. Deaths reported (unknown coded as 10).
21 February. AS fighters attacked an army base in Balad. Casualties reported.
21 February. SNA troops responded with fire after unidentified gunmen hurled a hand grenade at their checkpoint.
21 February. Jajeele clan militias attacked AS fighters in Beletweyne town; AS were forced to retreat.
21 February. Unknown gunmen hurled a hand grenade at the residence of a foreign national. It exploded in an empty space.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 20 February. At least 8 Ethiopian soldiers have been killed while 10 others were injured in an IED attack near Baardhere airport. AS claimed responsibility.
20 February. AS fighters killed the Deputy Attorney General of Somalia Mohamed Mursal in Hodan district as he drove to work.
20 February. AS fighters attacked government forces' base at Balcad. They were forced to retreat.
20 February. The bdy of a man from the Ogaden clan was found with gunshot wounds, south of Bacaadweyn town. He was reportedly carjacked before his death.
20 February. An unidentified person stabbed a person to death in Isracc. The deceased was from the Bantu clan.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 20 February. AS fighters detonated an IED against AMISOM soldiers on foot patrol in Sokowla. Some soldiers injured.
20 February. An IED planted by AS hit a civilian truck at Ceel Gelow in Jowhar. Some deaths reported (unknown coded as 10), AS transported the bodies for burial.
19 February. Some injuries occurred after a police car was targeted by a RCIED in Wardhigley district.
19 February. A hand grenade was thrown at a Jubaland Security Forces' base in Kismayo and landed in an open space.
On or before: 19 February. AS abducted hundreds of people from around El Bur town for refusing to accept AS's new taxation directive.
On or before: 19 February. AS abducted several people from El Garas in Galgaduud for not respecting AS's new taxation directive.
19 February. A UVIED attached to a private vehicle exploded at Muna hotel. No casualties reported.
19 February. A roadside RCIED detonated at the outskirts of Qalimow village. Trucks were damaged and casualties occurred.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 19 February. Jubaland forces reportedly killed three AS fighters in Wilmaro village, Amado district.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 19 February. AMISOM forces retaliated with heavy gunfire after suspected AS fighters hurled a hand grenade at them.
18 February. AS fighters killed a man from the Gaaljecel clan after a dispute over taxation.
18 February. Three officers physically abused a journalist in Mogadishu streets. Three days later they were arrested.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 18 February. AS forces retreated after they were attacked by the Joint military forces in the Western side of Jalalaqsi District.
18 February. Suspected AS militants shot and killed a senior military officer heading to his office in Afgooye (off-duty).
18 February. Militia from the Sa'ad clan abducted a man from the Omar Mohamoud Clan to allegedly demand the release of their relative.
18 February. An armed individual threw a hand grenade at an organization building, near Baidoa General Hospita. The grenade landed near the gate and no casualty occurred.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 17 February. AMISOM troops' convoy traveling between ex-control Balcad and SOS junction were hit by two landmine explosions.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 17 February. AS militants carried out an attack against a Joint Security Defensive Base located at Barawe Airport neighborhood. Some soldiers were injured.
17 February. A South Galkayo Hospital ambulance was carjacked together with the staff and two patients by a Sa'ad clan militia at the outskirts of Bitaale village.
17 February. Young brothers between the ages of 2 to 7 were injured after a grenade they were playing with exploded at Ceel Gaal village. The hand grenade might have fallen from security forces.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 17 February. AS attacked an AMISOM convoy at Soqola with twin IED explosions. Security personnel injured and a water truck damaged.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 17 February. Al Shabaab fighters fired mortar rounds and gunfire at an AMISOM-Djibouti base in Jalalaqsi town, Hiiraan region. AMISOM troops responded with gunfire, forcing the attackers to retreat. No casualty reported.
16 February. Two AS fighters shot and killed a businessman while in his shop at Hawl Wada.
16 February. AS fighters were forced to retreat when a government military vehicle was targeted by a RCIED explosion in Heliwa followed by a brief gunfire exchange.
16 February. UVIED attached to a private vehicle belonging to a clan elder, detonated and injured the occupant at Via Liberia village vicinity in Waberi district. No arrests were made.
16 February. A mid-level AS commander was killed after a government soldier attacked three AS fighters on foot, near Dudumaale village.

16 February. Clashes broke out between Abgaal militiamen and AS at Qoryaale Village over AS' arrest of traditional leaders. The clan had broken ceasefire rules and attacked the Hawadle clan. No casualties were reported from the clash with AS.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 16 February. AS fighters attacked AMISOM and government forces' defensive base in Qoryooley. Some casualties and injuries were reported.
16 February. SLP in Mohamud Haybe arrested unspecified number of youngsters accused of fueling unrest in Mahamud Haybe.
16 February. Abgaal clan militiamen shot and killed a man from Hawaadle clan, at Qoryaale Village following a tension between the two clans in the area.
16 February. A suspected AS member hurled a hand grenade at Junction base located near Haji Jama Mosque; the grenade exploded in an open space.
15 February. A soldier killed a civilian after an altercation between the two.

actor2: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: 15 February. Mortar rounds were fired against US military base known as Balidoogle. AS claimed to have killed three US soldiers.
15 February. AS fighters attacked a military vehicle in Afgooye. AS said it has seized the vehicle and weapons from the government soldiers.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 15 February. AMISOM EOD team destroyed a RCIED planted outside the main gate of Bulo-Burte airport.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 15 February. JLF attacked AS fighters near Welmaro village.
15 February. AS were attacked by government forces at Mahaday. Deaths and injuries reported, taken to Fidow area (coded as 10 unknown fatalities).
15 February. Residents of Ahmed-gurey demonstrated demanding the release of Sheikh Adan Sunaa. Police dispersed the protesters.
15 February. A RCIED planted by the roadside exploded and injured some government soldiers while it was being demolished.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 15 February. AS fighters fired three mortar rounds towards a joint military FOB: Forward Operating Bases in Bar-sanguni village but all landed in an open space.
14 February. A government military officer's vehicle heading to Mogadishu was targeted by a RCIED. Some of the occupants were injured.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 13 February. Al Shabaab fighters attacked AMISOM forces at their base in the town of Jalaqsi in Hiraan province.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: 13 February. AFRICOM's two airstrikes against AS in Janalle killed 11 fighters.
13 February. A hand grenade was hurled at a security checkpoint in Hodan; soldiers reacted with gunfire towards the suspected direction of the perpetrator/s.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 13 February. An AMISOM convoy from Academy en route to Maslah fell into an IED explosion at Soqola village in Huriwa district.
13 February. An IED was fitted on a luxury car that belonged to a Benadir Regional Administration personnel, but it was safely dismantled by the EOD team.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 13 February. Three explosions targeted AMISOM convoys traveling near Ex-control Bal'ad in Mogadishu. No casualties reported.
13 February. An UVIED attached to a vehicle owned by a South West state member of parliament detonated opposite Hassan Waqoyi Carwash. The official's driver was killed.
13 February. Police and military clashed when the military attempted to loot women who were selling the local narcotic mirra in Kismayo. No casualty reported.
13 February. AS fighters launched a hit and run attack on government forces at Makuudo village. No casualties reported so far.
13 February. Local people staged a demonstration against the selection process of a district commissioner in Baardheere town.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 13 February. AS fighters fired three mortar rounds, followed by machine gunfire at the AMISOM base west of Jalalaqsi town.
12 February. AS fighters attacked a checkpoint in Buulo Folyo, which was manned by government soldiers.
12 February. Unknown number of AS fighters were arrested in a security operation in Bosaso.
12 February. An unknown assailant armed with a knife, stabbed and injured a man at Ruways Hotel in Burao.
12 February. A gunman from the Warsangeli clan shot and injured the owner of a retail shop from the same clan at Badhan village. Earlier, they had a fight over Khart Business.
12 February. Government security forces in Bar-sanguni conducted a security operation against suspected AS locations near Sangunini. Two IEDs were discovered and safely removed

12 February. The Somali government has detained a senior army officer named Farah Mohamed Turba for the killing of six AS fighters without any judicial proceeding on January 1st (coded in separate event).
12 February. A UVIED attached to private vehicle owned by a police officer exploded in Wadajir.
12 February. Colonel Hassan Dheere of the Somali National Police Force was killed, when an explosive device attached to his vehicle detonated in Muqdisho.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 12 February. The Somali National Army and Jubbaland state forces attacked al-Shabaab-held areas in the forest region of Kobon.
11 February. Armed militia believed to be loyal to Muktar Roobow, a former AS member, ambushed AS near Doondardir.

11 February. Government special forces supported by foreign allies, conducted an overnight raid on AS controlled area in Merka District, to capture senior Al Shabaab members. Heavy weapons were used and a number of casualties were reported.
11 February. Suspected AS fighters killed a local administration member at Bacadaha, in Hawlwadaag neighborhood of Beletweyne as he walked to his home.

11 February. Over 100 drivers demonstrated on the highway and blocked the road with heavy stones over the demise of their fellow driver who was killed by clan militias on the 5th of January 2019, in Beletweyne.
11 February. Unknown gunmen hurled a hand grenade at a checkpoint manned by government troops. The troops retaliated with gunfire and captured the assailant.
11 February. Suspected AS elements, shot and killed a businessman who owns a restaurant in Dharkenley.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 11 February. A vehicle laden with explosives attacked an AMISOM base and attempted to enter the main gate but it was hit by AMISOM troops. No detonation occurred.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 10 February. A Jubaland soldier was executed by the firing squad, after having been found guilty of killing his superior officer.
10 February. AS fighters conducted a hit and run attack against government forces located at Afgoye District.
10 February. AS laid an ambush against a vehicle carrying pro-government militias from XAAJI-CALI that resulted in casualties.
10 February. A man from Marehan militia fired indiscriminately Reer Biciidyahan clan/Majeerteen members at a shop in Galdogob. One killed, several others injured.
10 February. Unidentified gunmen fired at a Toyota mini-van and injured some passengers. It was heading from Dadaab refugee camps towards Dhobley.
10 February. Security forces managed to safely remove four IEDs which were planted in the middle of the road at Musexaji, Bar-Sanguni.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 10 February. An AMISOM soldier was wounded in AS grenade attack at Soqola market.

10 February. Water tanker drivers held a peaceful demonstration against the Wajale local authority and Ministry of water resources saying private water well owners denied them access to collect water.
10 February. Unidentified assailant hurled a hand grenade at local security forces who were at Kismayo District Commissioner's office and landed on an empty space.
10 February. At least 8 civilians injured after their truck came under gunfire near Haji Ali village of Adale in Middle Shabelle region by a self-organised military group, Ma'awsiley.
10 February. Unidentified gunmen hurled a hand grenade at government troops position and the soldiers retaliated with gunfire.
09 February. Armed local people exchanged gunfire over land dispute in Baidoa town. Casualties reported.
09 February. A UVIED attached to a vehicle owned by a government official detonated in Hamarjaja District. The official survived the assassination attempt while a female passenger was killed.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 09 February. A Jubaland soldier killed his superior officer due to an internal dispute. He was executed the next day (coded in separate event).
09 February. AS fighters carried out a hit and run attack on SNA checkpoint near Waraboole village.
09 February. An elder from Reer Biciidyahan clan/Majeerteen was killed by unknown gunman in North Galkayo.
09 February. AS fighters shot and injured a civilian man at Ceel Cali over issues related to collection of Zakawat.
09 February. Two groups of SNA and police exchanged gunfire in Dharkenley District.
09 February. Police killed a civilian businessman in Wadajir District because the victim refused to stop, when instructed by the police.
09 February. Suspected AS fighters burned at least three trucks loaded with charcoal near La foole. Three people including one driver were killed.
09 February. Suspected AS fighters killed a senior police officer on the way to his home in Hodan District.
08 February. Unidentified gunmen shot dead a man identified as Abdi Salad, who worked in Mogadishu's Kawa Godey.
08 February. AS killed two SNA soldiers in Bulo Mareer District, Lower Shabelle Region.
07 February. Al Shabaab clashed with Somali army in the road between Afgoye and Wanlaweyn, after AS ambushed a convoy of SNA troops.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: 07 February. US airstrike killed 4 AS fighters in Barrie vicinity.
06 February. AS sharia court in Jilib town amputated the right hands of two men after they were convicted of stealing property from a shop.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: 06 February. US airstrike killed 11 AS fighters in Gandarshe near Marka District.
05 February. AS fighters abducted unspecified number of children from Dinsoor town.
05 February. Two groups of government forces engaged in gunfire exchange. The clash was related to administrative disputes between two District officials.
05 February. Somali security forces arrested several people linked to Al-Shabaab.
05 February. A clan militiaman shot and killed a person from Habargidir clan. Motive was believed to be retaliation.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 05 February. AMISOM troops mistakenly shot and killed a pastoralist who was looking after his cattle East of Dhobley town.
05 February. JSF discovered an IED planted along the road IVO via-Afmadow. The EOD tea removed it safely.
05 February. Unknown armed group ambushed vehicles belonging to Dahabshiil Finance Company and injured the employees.
05 February. Unidentified warplanes conducted an airstrike targeting AS position at Garbaharey town.
05 February. Suspected AS fighters killed a government military officer while shopping near Bacadlaha Market vicinity in Hamarweyne.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 05 February. Somali National Intelligence Service Agency (NISA) said it had killed 40 Al-Shabaab militants in Farsoley village in Lower Shabelle.
05 February. Unidentified assailants with unknown motive, shot and killed a man in Wardhigley.
05 February. Two senior military commanders killed in an IED explosion in Dhanaane.
05 February. Following the February 04 explosion, the Commander of the Hamarweyne [police] station in Banaadir Region [Mogadishu], has been arrested.
04 February.Upon retreating after assassinating the P&O port chief in Bosaso (coded in separate event), AS clash with security forces, leaving one killed and one arrested.
04 February. AS forces attacked SNA and robbed food and money from the local population.
04 February. Unknown warplane conducted an airstrike targeting a suspected AS location in Afmadow town.
04 February. Police shot and killed a person while in his vehicle in Hodan.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 04 February. A RCIED explosion occurred targeting an AMISOM convoy. AMISOM soldiers retaliated. Casualties reported.
04 February. P&O Bosaso port chief assassinated by Al-Shabaab militants. Upon retreating, the attackers clash with security forces, leaving one killed and one arrested (coded in separate event).
04 February. A car bomb explosion at a restaurant adjacent to Mogadishu Mall killed at least 10 people, injured several. Al-Shabab claimed responsibility.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 03 February. AS fighters fired mortar shells and gunfire at the AMISOM base located in Jalalaqsi town. AMISOM forces retaliated and forced the attackers to retreat.
03 February. Two groups of government forces exchanged gunfire over money extortion.
03 February. Ayan Afrah, the leader of Somali National Women Union was shot and injured after armed men attacked her in a residential Hotel in Garowe.
03 February. Unidentified assailant shot and killed a civilian Tuktuk Driver, and fled the scene.
03 February. A SNAF soldier killed a vehicle driver following a dispute near Banadir Junction (KM5). The soldier demanded money and when the driver refused, he shot him.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 02 February. At least four Ethiopian soldiers were killed in an Al-Shabaab suicide bombing in Bardhere.
02 February. A RCIED planted on the roadside detonated, injuring some government soldiers who were traveling in the targeted vehicle. AS claimed responsibility for the attack.
02 February. A policeman was shot and killed after a fellow police officer accidentally discharged his weapon at the police station in Baidoa.
02 February. Police shot and killed a man at his house in Jarrato neighborhood in Hargeisa.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: 02 February. A number of AS fighters were killed after U.S. military conducted an airstrike near Gendershe neighborhood in Marka to prevent them from using remote areas. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.
02 February. AS fighters carried out an attack against security forces ' positions in Afgoye from different directions for about half an hour, before they were forced to retreat.
02 February. A man who hailed from Sa'ad clan was shot and injured by a fellow clan member in South Galkayo.
02 February. Unidentified warplanes carried out an airstrike against an AS base located in Tiyeeglow district.
02 February. Unidentified warplanes conducted an airstrike targeting an AS hide out in the northern outskirts of Buqgoosaar village. The hideout was hit.
02 February. A policeman with unknown motive shot and killed a person inside a Tuktuk.
02 February. Armed clashes between AS and IS continued around Dhadaar village. Casualties on both sides were reported.

assoc_actor_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 02 February. IEDs laid out by AS militants reportedly went off on routes used by AMISOM and SNA Security forces during patrols.
01 February. Suspected AS fighters launched a hit and run attack on government troops in Merka.The attack was initiated with RPGs followed by heavy machine guns.
01 February. A militiaman hailing from Makanne clan shot and killed a fellow clan member in Belet Weyne.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 01 February. AS fighters conducted IED attacks against AMISOM convoys travelling from Tabda and Qoqani to Afmadow. At least three explosions were reported.
01 February. Gunmen from Dhulbahante/ Hayaagsub clan shot and killed a fellow clan member at Buuhoodle.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-); Government of Somalia (2017-)
notes: 01 February. A tax collector accompanied by Military Police fired on a Tuk-tuk at a checkpoint in Afgoye. A passenger and one SNAF soldier were injured.
01 February. Unknown warplane conducted an airstrike against an AS militant location in Adado town.
01 February. Unknown group hurled a hand grenade at the Biya-Degeenka checkpoint neighborhood. Police at the station reacted with gunfire towards the direction of the attack.
31 January. AS and Pro-IS forces clashed in Sheebaab. IS attacked as Al-Shabaab were lecturing villagers, at least one IS member killed.
31 January. Suspected Al-Shabab fighters in Balcad engaged in exchange of heavy gunfire with soldiers.
31 January. AS fighters ambushed an SNA military convoy, killing 11 soldiers, including a commander
31 January. AS fighters attacked civilians near Koban village.
31 January. AS fighters seized and burnt down seven trucks carrying charcoal at Doonka village.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 31 January. An IED exploded against an AMISOM vehicle in Middle Juba, causing casualties and damagng the vehicle.
31 January. An RCIED concealed in an empty bag at a trash dumping site exploded west of Beletweyne. Some people were injured.
31 January. Al-Shabab's artillery unit shelled a base hosting Jubbaland soldiers in Bar Sanguni. Several mortars landed on the base.
31 January. Suspected AS elements killed an army officer who had attended the Mosque for morning prayers.
31 January. A hand grenade was hurled at the Wadajir Police Station by unknown assailants and police reacted with gunfire.
31 January. AS and Pro-IS forces clashed in Dhadaar, Bari.
31 January. A RCIED planted between Wanleweyn and Afgoye districts, targeted a military vehicle, leaving four soldiers killed. Al-Shabab claimed responsibility.
30 January. A truck that belonged to a third-party contractor of an international NGO was captured and burnt down by AS in Jowhar.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
notes: 30 January. Two groups of Puntland forces exchanged gunfire over khaat resulting in dead and injured. Unknown fatalities coded at low estimate of 3.
30 January. A RCIED targeted an army convoy from Jazeera heading to Merka military base. The explosion was followed by heavy gunfire. AS claimed to have captured an army wagon.
30 January. Unidentified warplanes conducted three airstrikes against AS hide outs in Beletweyne town. Deaths and injuries were reported (unknown number coded as 10).
30 January. Unknown warplane conducted an airstrike targeting an AS hideout located east of Bu'ale town.
30 January. Anti-AS forces conducted an airstrike targeting an AS hideout located North East of Afmadow district.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 30 January. Al-Shabab fighters attacked positions of foreign forces in Qoryoley town, sparking heavy fighting.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: 30 January. The US military killed 24 AS fighters in an airstrike near Shebeeley.
30 January. Suspected Al Shabaab gunmen shot and killed a renowned elder identified as Hayesi Mursal in Afgooye.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 29 January. Al-Shabab attacked a base belonging to Kenyan forces in the Arba'ow area of Elasha Biyah. Heavy fighting ensued lasting for hours.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 29 January. A JSF soldier shot and injured 3 teenage boys who were part of a group playing near the river in Luuq. Motive for the attack is unknown.
29 January. Government forces in Bur Hakaba town repulsed an attack by small number of Shabaab attackers on motorcycles.
29 January. At least 2 people dead, 5 wounded, several vehicles destroyed when a car bomb exploded in Mogadishu. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
29 January. Inmates attacked a British prisoner with razor blades in a Somali jail. He survived.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: 29 January. Heavy fighting took place in Jalalaqsi between the Djibouti forces and AS.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 29 January. Al-Shabab fighters targeted Kenyan forces with explosives as they were travelling between Dhobley town and the Tabta area in Lower Jubba region.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 28 January. SNA killed a senior al-Shabab official in an operation in the country's central town of Jalalaqsi.
28 January. A gunman from Dhulbahante/Qayaad Sub-Clan shot and seriously injured a man from Dhulbahante/Baharsame Sub-Clan in Madareemin neighborhood of Lascanod.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 28 January. Series of explosions occurred in central Bosaso town hitting a Puntland police station. AS claimed responsibility.
27 January. Al-Shabaab attacked an SWSPF convoy escorting Lt Colonel Abdirahman Osman Abrone and 3 soldiers. Colonel Abrone was commander of Southwest State Forces in Buur Hakaba.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: 25 January. Some Burundian soldiers on foot patrol from Mahaday to Buurne were hit by an IED.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 25 January. A JSF convoy travelling from Dhobley to Afmadow was hit by an IED. There were causalities and the injured were evacuated to Afmadow hospital.
25 January. 11 soldiers killed in roadside bomb explosion near Afmadow town. The attack was claimed by Al Shabaab.
24 January. Two armed clan militia from Mursade and Hawadle clashed at Mihas district. Fatalities and injuries were recorded (unknown coded as 10).

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 24 January. AMISOM combat helicopters conducted an airstrike in Buurhakaba district targeting AS detention facility in the area. Casualties are unaccounted yet.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 24 January. Ethiopian helicopters bomb AS controlled village near Baidoa town, Somalia.
24 January. The Ethiopian Air Force carried out an airstrike on Al-Shabab base in Burr Haybe. About 35 Al-Shabaab militants, including operation head in the area, were killed.
24 January. AS militants killed some government employees (assumed military forces) and took their pistols (unknown fatalities coded at 10)

24 January. Suspected AS fighters carried out a hit and run attack on the District Commissioner's residence in Howlwadag District. The attack started with a hand grenade followed by heavy machine guns.
23 January. An IED concealed in a vehicle owned by a financial institution, detonated and injured some people.
23 January. Two armed groups clashed in Berbera town over land issues. No casualties were reported.
23 January. Unidentified men driving a civilian vehicle hurled a hand grenade at the residence of Regional Women Representative. The security guards at the scene responded with fire.
23 January. Ethiopian nationals were shot by unknown assailants. Some dead and injured (fatalities coded at low estimate of 3).
23 January. Two armed men, suspected to be either AS or IS elements, shot and killed a young businessman in Bakara.
23 January. Mursade Clan militias shot and killed some family members from Hawadle clan over land issues (fatalities coded at low estimate of 3).
23 January. SLP in Buroa fired several bullets into the air to stop a clash between two groups over a land dispute. Some people were injured by stray bullets.
23 January. Unknown warplane conducted an airstrike targeting AS vehicle in Jilib town. The vehicle was damaged, and the driver escaped.
22 January. Syrian doctor and his driver killed when a bomb fitted in a vehicle exploded inside the hospital in Mogadishu.
22 January. Suspected AS fighters killed a government employee in Hodan.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
notes: 22 January. AS fired mortar rounds to Darawish Soldiers' bases in Afurur and Galgala.
22 January. A government soldier killed a fellow female soldier at his camp in Dhobley town.
22 January. Clan based gunmen opened gunfire on family members and as a result, some children and their mother died in the attack (fatalities coded at low estimate of 3).

assoc_actor_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 22 January. Jubaland Security Forces discovered an IED planted near the borehole East of Dhobley town. AMISOM safely removed the device.

22 January. A government ambulance was hit and damaged by a RCIED in Hawlwadag. Some fatalities and injuries were reported (unknown number coded at low estimate of 3). AS group claimed responsibility of the attack.
22 January. A RCIED exploded inside a teashop in Heegan of Hawlwadaag neighbourhood. There were no casualties.
21 January. A hand grenade was hurled at the District Branch Office near Sigaale village, in Hodan District. Soldiers reacted with gunfire in the direction of the attack.
21 January. Two militia groups from north and south Galkayo exchanged gunfire in Horumar area, east of Galkayo causing some injuries.
21 January. A soldier opened fire inside a restaurant in Garowe. A cooking gas cylinder in the restaurant was hit by the bullet and exploded causing death and injuries (unknown number coded as 10).

21 January. A family in the East of Adale Town was murdered by local militiamen due to suspected inter-clan tension between the two Abgaal sub-clans (Celi Omar and Abdall Aroone) (unknown number coded at low estimate of 3).
21 January. IED targeted an army water-tank truck in the outskirt of Dhanaane village in Merka. Some soldiers were injured. AS claimed responsibility.
21 January. A suspected UVIED explosion occurred outside the City Hospital located in Hodan District. AS is suspected to be behind it.
21 January. Two groups of government forces engaged in an exchange of gunfire, over extortion money between the two groups.
20 January. AS fighters reportedly fired mortar rounds from multiple locations against the Somali forces in Bar-Sanguni. Soldiers were injured.
20 January. The clans of Essa and Mohamed Asse of Samaron clashed due to a land dispute in Gargara village.
20 January. A road side IED which was being prepared by AS militants near Siinka Dheer prematurely exploded and killed the perpetrators who were preparing it (low fatality estimate assumed)

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 20 January 2019. In Mogadishu-Daynile (Daynile, Banadir), the dead bodies of former NISA soldiers caught by AS and sentenced to death were found with gunshot wounds. (Unknown number coded as 3).

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
notes: 19 January. A Darawish soldier was shot by unknown perpetrators at the Masjidul Rashid area of Bosaso.
19 January. External forces conducted an airstrike targeting AS convoy believed to be behind the Barsanguni attack at SNA base located near Kismayo town.
19 January. Al Shabaab has allegedly abducted dozens of school children near Tiyeglow town, Bakool.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 19 January. A hand grenade was hurled towards the PSF soldiers conducting patrol in the Bossaso main market, injuring a soldier and a civilian were injured.
19 January. AS militants reportedly killed two government staff members in Howlwadag District.
