actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 28 November. Al Shabaab militants ambushed an AMISOM convoy moving along Shalambood road at El-Waregow village. No casualties reported.

assoc_actor_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 28 November. Unidentified armed men shot and killed a civilian man who worked with AMISOM at the livestock market neighbourhood in Heliwa district. Police later on arrested several people.
28 November. Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against Jajeele clan militias at Ceel-Cadde village. There was an exchange of small arms fire.

28 November. A tax collector was shot dead by a police officer in front of the Bossaso municipality building following a disagreement due to the tax collector's refusal to stop after being halted by the policeman.
28 November. AS fighters were observed moving at the outskirt of Jalalaqsi town. Reports indicated that the movement of AS fighters was unusual.

28 November. A RCIED planted by al Shabaab targeting a SNA battlewagon travelling outside of Merka, exploded between Gendershe and Dhanaane vicinity near Gendershe village. The target vehicle was damaged by the blast.
27 November. Al Shabaab fighters killed Darul Amal School director at his school at Nakarumo village in Afgoye district.

27 November. SLP arrested an unspecified number of taxi drivers of specific saloon vehicles in Hargeisa after a peaceful demonstration against the banning of specific saloon vehicle taxis from transporting passengers and goods outside of Hargeisa.
27 November. Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNA forces at Hees Village.
27 November. A famous musician in Hargeisa was attacked by three unknown men at her home. The musician sustained 3 stab wounds.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: 27 November. One soldier was injured when an IED exploded at AMISOM Djiboutian National Defence Forces (DNDF) who were safely defusing the IEDs.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 27 November. Al Shabaab attackers shot and severely injured a NISA soldier at Bar Italy vicinity in Waberi district.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: 27 November. US strikes killed at least three AS fighters in Qay Adr, Mudug.
27 November. A man killed a pregnant woman after a verbal disagreement at the Zone K village neighbourhood in Hodan district.
26 November. SLP arrested youths suspected of creating unrest in Mohammad Haybe district of Hargeisa. An unspecified number of youth gangs were arrested by police.
26 November. SNA forces manning the entrance CP into Mahaday district shot at a mini-bus carrying vegetable and passengers after the driver refused to stop at the CP. The perpetrator was arrested.
27 November. Al Shabaab killed a government soldier at a coffee restaurant near Ex. Arwo Taleex vicinity in Hodan district. The perpetrators stole the pistol of the victim.
26 November. EOD experts from NISA and Somali police forces safely defused an IED, planted near KPP junction road neighbourhood in Hodan district.
26 November. AS elements killed Al Kifaaf School director at Coca Cola factory in Yaqshid district. Motive unknown.

26 November. An unknown group hurled a hand grenade at a police force position at the Office of the District Commissioner vicinity in Bondheere district. The police forces opened gunfire to the direction of the attack.

26 November. A UVIED, attached to a private vehicle owned by a clan elder, detonated at his house in the vicinity in Deyniile district. The targeted person was not in the vehicle but casualties and damage of property.
26 November. A Toyota vehicle laden with explosive devices, parked in Kawo-Godey khat market vicinity in Wadajir district, exploded. The explosion burnt merchandise in the vicinity.
26 November. Unidentified armed men killed a businessman in his shop at Godey village vicinity in Heliwa district.
25 November. Al Shabaab attacked the residence of a prominent religious leader in South Galkayo. AS elements were later neutralized by security forces.
25 November. Al Shabaab attacked an SNA checkpoint at Makuda village using small arms fire. Casualties unknown.
25 November. Al Shabaab fighters abducted four Macawisley clan militias at Jalalaqsi district in the residence of one of the militiamen.
25 November. Clan militia shot at a group of civilians sitting outside of their home in Warsheekh district. The motive of the attack was clan retaliation. Casualities unknown.

actor1: Police Forces of Somalia (2017-) Prison Guards
notes: 25 November. A person was killed after police forces opened fire at prisoners who attempted to escape from the prison in North Galkayo.
25 November. An IED exploded at Adaada Siliga neighbourhood in Baidoa town. Government forces may have been the target but a civilian woman was injured.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 25 November. Suspected al Shabaab elements killed an alleged NISA officer, who was at a football field at Mana-polyo junction vicinity in Shibis district.

25 November. A RCIED, targeting a battlewagon transporting a high-ranking police officer of Wardhigley district, exploded at Labo - Dhagax village vicinity in Wardhigley District. The vehicle was damaged, and some people were injured.
25 November. AS elements shot and injured a police officer, who was shopping near Kawo-Godey village vicinity in Dharkenley District.
25 November. An official of al Shabaab was killed by one of his bodyguards in Hudur town, the capital of Bakool Region.
25 November. Suspected al Shabaab militants shot dead a senior military officer at Bangala village vicinity in Dayniile district.
24 November. AS fighters ambushed a military convoy carrying Somali government troops in the outskirts of Balcad town. No casualties reported so far.
24 November. AS elements killed an SNA soldier near Black-Sea junction vicinity in Hodan district.
24 November. Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade and opened fire at a police station followed by exchanges from both sides in Las'anood city. No casualties reported.
24 November. A Somaliland marine officer was killed by his fellow officer over alleged personal dispute at El Sheikh District.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 24 November. A JSF soldier killed his fellow soldier, in the same unit, over an alleged personal dispute at Bula-Gudud village.
23 November. Fighting erupted in the town of Afmadoow when heavily armed AS fighters engaged government troops in a fire fight. Casualties unreported so far.
23 November. AS fighters attacked Unsi village and also hijacked passengers in four vehicles that were being transported to Dollow district.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 23 November. An IED planted near a Livestock Market neighbourhood in Heliwa District was diffused by NISA.
23 November. A RCIED, targeting a SNA vehicle, exploded in Yaqshid district. There was a brief exchange of gunfire between the perpetrators and SNA.
23 November. A RCIED, targeting SNA soldiers accompanying a battlewagon travelling in the General Daud Road vicinity, exploded near Towfiq market in Yaqshid district.
23 November. Suspected AS killed a businessman who owned a shop at Hormud building vicinity in Wadajir District. Motive unknown but suspected to be related to recent targeting of businesspeople.
22 November. SNA forces conducted operations in al Shabaab strongholds in Gendershe. SNA managed to briefly take control of the village but later retreated.
22 November. AS fighters ambushed SNA convoy travelling on the near Warmaxan village. An IED also exploded on the convoy and there was an exchange of heavy gunfire.

22 November. SNA soldiers blocked Buundaweyne South bridge and Liiqliiqato bridge disrupting movements of all vehicles in and out of Beletweyne town over delay in payment of salaries. SNA commanders intervened.
22 November. A man was killed by armed assailants in New Bossaso area. The motive of the action was unknown.
22 November. Al Shabaab fighters planted two IEDs that detonated at Dinsoor stadium. The blast destroyed two structures.
22 November. Unidentified assailants killed a prominent businessman at Bakara market in Howlwadag district.
22 November. SLA and militias loyal to the defected Col. Aare clashed at a Somaliland military camp in El-Afwayn district. No casualties reported.
21 November. After killing a local elder in Belethawa, AS fighters proceeded towards the police station and exchanged gunfire with the local forces.
21 November. Unknown armed men killed a court worker in front of the Ministry of Transport in Lanta Hawada area. The motive of the act was unknown.

21 November. Somali National Army said it killed 28 al-Shabab militants and seized areas and villages in Jilib-Marca. The army also said senior al-Shabab foreign fighters from Kuwait, Lebanon and Sudan were killed.
21 November. AS member hurled a hand grenade at the residence of Luuq Police Commander. The hand grenade exploded at an open space in compound.
21 November. Construction labourers demonstrated peacefully in front of the Office of the Governor of Sahil region against construction companies who employed foreign workers instead of the locals.
21 November. Militiamen loyal to Col. Caare and SNA clashed at the outskirt of Elafweyn. There were no reports of casualties
21 November. AS fighters beheaded a prominent elder in Kalboley neighbourhood in Belethawa town and abducted two of his sons from his residence.
21 November. An IED explosion occurred at a checkpoint manned by SNA forces in Afgoye district. One SNA soldier was killed and two others were injured.
21 November. AS fighters ambushed two rickshaws that were carrying food commodities near Faraq village (c. 09 km east of Hudur). One of them was taken and the other escaped.
21 November. Unknown armed group kidnapped a man and his wife in Heliwa District, shot and wounded them and returned their bodies to their home. Motives unknown.
21 November. Suspected ISIS militants killed two staff members of a telecommunications company at Bakara junction in Howlwadag district.
20 November. Somali Member of Parliament Dahir Amin Jesow has reportedly survived an assassination attempt when a bomb fitted into his car detonated in Waaberi district.
20 November. RCIED, planted by AS targeting a ENDF convoy travelling from Baidoa to Dolow, was found in Yurkut village. The RCIED was safely destroyed by the ENDF EOD team.
20 November. A SNA soldier died after UVIED placed on his vehicle detonated at Zone K neighbourhood in Hodan district. AS took responsibility.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: 20 November. The US conducted airstrike against AS base at Harardheere district in Mudug region. Several vehicles belonging to AS, en-route to their bases, were destroyed. AFRICOM said six were killed.
20 November. A hand grenade was hurled into the compound of UN staff members in Farjano village. No casualty has been reported.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 19 November. Ethiopian troops were targeted by AS as they were leaving Baidoa and heading to Bardale District.
19 November. Al-Shabab forces attacked a military base belonging to the militia of the administration of Ahmed Madobe in Abdila Birole area, leading to fierce fighting.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
notes: 19 November. AS attacked residents of Dhagaxyaale village. The residents supported by Galmudug Security forces fought back. Two fighters from each were killed.
19 November. An unspecified number of youth gangs were arrested by SLP during a security operation for allegedly creating unrest in the Mohammad Haybe district in Hargeisa.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: 19 November. Two separate US airstrikes against al-Shabab militants near Debatscile village in central Somalia. The first killed 27 militants, the second killed 10. Coded as two separate events.
19 November. AS militants killed two government soldiers who were sitted in a Restaurant in Howlwadag district.
19 November. The Jubaland Regional State executed a soldier known as Abdirizak Abdullahi with a firing squad in the port city of Kismaayo.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)

18 November. An RCIED by AS targeting the vehicle of the custodial corps force officer exploded near Weydow village in Deynile district. An officer and a civilian passerby were killed.
18 November. Two passengers were injured after an armed militia shot at a food truck in Afgoye district. They shot because the driver refused to stop as they ordered.
18 November. A man from Omar Mohamud clan was stabbed to death by another man from the same clan at Israac village in North Galkayo over an unknown dispute.
18 November. After a grenade attack on a police station in Galkayo, journalist Farhan Farah Abdi of Radio Jareiban, was stabbed by unknown attackers.
18 November. Suspected al Shabaab/pro-ISIS militants killed an SNA officer at Bakara junction road neighbourhood in Hodan district. Soldiers arrested several suspects later on.
18 November. Unknown gunmen threw a grenade at a police station in Galkayo. One killed and several wounded.

17 November. Armed militia, allegedly anti-AS fighters locally known as 'Macawisley', shot at a vehicle carrying animals to Mogadishu. Additional reports indicated that the vehicle was targeted by the militia group because it belonged to AS.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 17 November. RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy in Qoryoley, detonated; ensuing gunfire between AMISOM and AS injured four AMISOM fighters.
17 November. Taxi drivers in Hargeisa held a demonstration against a recent travel ban by the Somaliland Ministry of Transport on the use of Toyota Vitz as taxis. Arrests reported.

17 November. Somaliland authorities issued a directive that restricts all Toyota Vitz taxis from using the road that passes in front of Somaliland Presidential State House. Motive of the directive is related to security.
17 November. Residents protested against the newly appointed District Commissioner during his arrival in Bardheere. Security forces escorting the Commissioner shot at the protesters, injuring four.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: 17 November. One soldier from AMISOM Burundi was killed after an RCIED by al Shabaab fighters detonated in Heliwa district.

16 November. Al Shabaab fighters hurled a hand grenade at an SNA check point located opposite Lamagalay Military Camp in Hilaac neighbourhood. No casualties reported.
16 November. One SNA soldier was killed due to an explosion of an IED, targeting SNA soldiers on foot patrol at Bar-sanguni village.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Maritime Police Force
notes: 16 November. Three PMPF: Puntland Maritime Police Force were wounded when their vehicle due to a detonation of RCIED by AS in the Galgala area.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 16 November. An unspecified number of Puntland soldiers were deployed near Tukaraq in anticipation of renewed clashes between Somali and Puntland forces.
16 November. Community members and supporters of Muqtar Robow held a peaceful demo in Hudur town protesting FGS' intervention in the upcoming South West State presidential elections.
16 November. Al Shabaab hurled hand grenade at government troops patrolling the Livestock Market in Heliwa district. One soldier was injured.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 16 November. A BNDF logistics convoy returning from Jowhar is hit by a roadside IED in Suuqa Xoloha. One AMISOM soldier is killed and another injured.

15 November. Suspected pro-ISIS men killed a staff member of a telecommunications company at livestock Market in Heliwa district. The motive is allegedly due to the refusal of the company to give financial support to the group.
15 November. An Under Vehicle Improvised Explosive Device detonated at Bakara market area in Howlwadaag district. One person was killed while two others were injured.
15 November. Unknown attackers killed a staff member of a printing company at Sepiano neighbourhood in Hodan district. They stole the mobile phone of the deceased.
15 November. A person was killed after a landmine detonated at Bakara Market area of Mogadishu, Hodan District. A Government vehicle was the target.

assoc_actor_2: Majeerteen Clan Group (Somalia); Government of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
notes: 15 November. Sa'ad clan militia kidnapped a man suspected to be from Majeerteen clan. Galmudug local authorities and elders attempted to secure the release of the victim.
15 November. Community members held a peaceful demo in Berdale district protesting FGS' intervention in the upcoming South West State presidential elections.
15 November. Unknown attackers killed a young man at Labo dhagax vicinity in Wardhiigley district. Motive unknown.
14 November. Al Shabaab fighters hurled a hand grenade at government position in Heliwa district and the troops responded after the blast. No casualties reported.
14 November. Al Shabaab fighters hurled a hand grenade at an SNA position in Hodan district. The security forces opened gunfire after the explosion and briefly closed the road. Two civilian injured.
14 November. Clash between two clans led to the injury of two civilians in Bossaso.
14 November. Clash between Sa'ad and Wagardhac clans militia in Galinsoor left one person wounded. The clash was related to a previous clan feud between the two clans.
14 November. An influential elder hailing from Gaaljecel clan killed by AS elements near Beletweyne town.
14 November. One clan militia was killed when two clan militia clashed at Laba-Garas settlement in Cadale district of Middle Shabelle region. The motive of clash is unknown.

assoc_actor_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 14 November. AS fighters ambushed AMISOM, ENDF and SNA convoy near Lug-Habar village. Heavy gunfire exchange followed the ambush. No casualties reported.
13 November. A soldier was killed after police and military units clashed at Kawa-Godey village in Dharkenley district over alleged because of alleged 'suspicion between the two forces.'

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 13 November. Somalia's National Intelligence and Security Agency (NISA) confirmed the arrest of an Islamic State (IS) operative in Mogadishu, who was in charge of finance.
13 November. Suspected AS fighters killed a pastoralist at Dado-Duqati grazing area (c. 130 km west of Kismayo). Another civilian was reportedly abducted.

13 November. An unidentified armed group hurled a hand grenade at police in Dharkenley district. The HG landed on an empty place near the soldiers' position. The forces shot at the direction of the HG.
13 November. An unidentified clan militia ambushed a SLA escorting the mission of Somaliland Minister of Interior and Somaliland Minister of Water in Dhumay. No casualties reported.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Maritime Police Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Maritime Police Force
notes: 13 November. An officer of the Puntland Maritime Police Force (PMPF) killed one of his colleagues due to alleged personal dispute.
13 November. Suspected ISIS assassins killed a staff member of a telecommunications company and injured another at Bar-Ubah junction in Howlwadag district. A female bystander was wounded.
12 November. Suspected AS fighters killed a local government official near Maka-Al-Mukarama road in Waberi district. Residents captured one of the fighters.

12 November. Al-Shabaab fighters in Jilib town shot dead a foreign fighter (not identified) in a mosque after he rejected to surrender, pulled a hand grenade as Al-Shabaab militants tried to detain him for being 'Anti-Al-Shabaab'.
12 November. About 100 people demonstrated against the arrest and demanding release of 'Abdirisak Hussein Tahliil' in South Galkayo, accused of having links with AS.

13 November. Armed militia kidnapped several passengers travelling by road between Ceel-Geelow and Gololey settlement in Balcad district. The passengers were robbed of their belongings and assaulted by the armed militia.
12 November. AS fighters attacked government troops positioned at KM50 neighbourhood in Afgoye district. AS fighters were repelled. No casualties reported.
12 November. An explosion of a RCIED planted by al Shabaab in Ceel-Xaaji village in Marka town affected SNA troops. Fatalities unknown.
12 November. Al Shabaab fighters abducted a civilian woman in her own teashop in Makuda village.
11 November. Al Shabaab fighters executed a 15-year-old boy in Shaw village. The teen was accused of sexually assaulting another male teenager and sentenced to execution by the AS court.
11 November. AS Amniyats, hurled a hand grenade at government troops positioned at Tadamun village in Afgoye district. Security forces opened gunfire after the explosion. No fatalities reported.
11 November. AS fighters ambushed a vehicle transporting khat near Mooda Mooda village with SNA soldier. AS fighters retreated.

11 November. Residents of Garbaharrey town staged a demonstration against the visit of Jubaland State President. The cause is the tensions between the Jubbaland state and the Federal Government of Somalia.
11 November. A pastoralist man from Dir clan was shot dead by armed pastoralist men from Sa'ad clan at Towfiq district in suspected clan revenge.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 11 November. AS fighters planted an IED which exploded and killed ENDF contingent and SWSPF convoy near Jeera Gurey village. One ENDF and two South West State Police Force (SWSPF) soldiers were killed.
11 November. Somali security forces in Barawe discovered the dead body of a 28 years old female in Abasiibo village, Barawe district, who was killed after a sexual assault.
11 November. Al Shabaab killed a government official at Seypiano village in Hodan district. The man was working at state house. Motive unknown.
10 November. Ambush by an armed group in Weydow district, outskirts of Muqdishu, left one civilian and two government soldiers dead.
10 November. Al Shabaab fighters killed an electoral delegate of South-West State regional administration at Weydow area in Deynile district.
10 November. A man from Sa'ad clan was killed by an armed man from Suleiman clan in Cadaado town in a clan retaliation.
10 November. An armed man from the Omar Mohamud clan killed another member of his own clan due to a land dispute near Masjid Al-Huda at Israac village in North Galkayo.
10 November. A civilian man from Suleiman clan was killed by an armed man from Sa'ad clan in Hobyo town due to an alleged dispute.

actor2: Police Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
notes: 10 November. Local militia led by Ali Hassan attacked Galmudug Police who were conducting a house to house search of the town. At least 1 officer was killed before the Police withdrew.
10 November. An armed man killed a girl, who was in a mini-bus in Siinaay area of Kismayo town. Motive unknown.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 09 November. Three Vehicle Bourne Improvised Explosive Devices (VBIED) explosions occurred outside three main buildings - Hotel Hayaat, Sahafi Hotel and the CID HQs - at KM4 in Hodan district. Armed clashes followed between Al Shabab fighters and NISA. The event claimed the lives of at least 50 people.
09 November. A civilian was injured after a Remote Controlled Improvised Explosive Device (RCIED) planted along Macalin Nur Road detonated.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 08 November. AMISOM troops responded by opening gunfire when an IED targeted their convoy in Jowhar, Middle Shabelle region. Casualties unknown.
08 November. Roadside explosion IED targeting Somali National Army (SNA) at Elasha-Biyaha neighbourhood, Afgoye district injured two soldiers and two other people.
08 November. Two people were killed when their mini-bus was ambushed by Al Shabab fighters on the road between Warmahan and Wanleweyn district, Lower Shabelle Region.
08 November. Abdiweli Mohamed Ibrahim, a state minister and member of regional parliament, was killed due to an explosion of a car bomb fitted into his car Mogadishu.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 07 November. Ethiopian troops were deployed to Dhumay and Saaxdheer in Lascaanod to intervene in the recent clan clashes in the region.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 07 November. AMISOM armoured personnel carrier (APC) accidentally hit and killed one JSF soldier in Shaqalaha village.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 07 November. Several residents in Hodan, Mogadishu city protested against AMISOM troops involved in a shooting incident in Heliwa district on 6 November by throwing stones at AMISOM convoys.
07 November. Al Shabaab fighters abducted three international staff members of an INGO working from local health center in Balet hawa town and took them to Ceel cade village.
07 November. An armed group killed a civilian and injured a staff member of Hormud Telecom at Elasha-Biyaha village, Afgoye District. The motive for the killing is unknown.
07 November. Police diffused an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) planted on the roadside alongside the Lafole settlement, Afgoye District.
07 November. Armed men hijacked a vehicle owned by Puntland's MP as he was driving it in the centre of Garowe town. The motive is said to be clan related.
06 November. The Taiwan Tuna Longline Association reported a Taiwanese FV was attacked by possible Somali pirates near the Port of Kismayo.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 06 November. AMISOM forces were targeted by a Remote Controlled Improvised Explosive Device (RCIED) near Heliwa. The perpetrators are likely al Shabaab, though this was not confirmed by the source.
06 November. Following the killing of civilians by AMISOM forces in Mogadishu, youth barred main roads along the area burning tires in protest of the killings.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 06 November. AMISOM forces reportedly killed four civilians in Mogadishu. Reason unknown.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 06 November. A civilian was killed when AMISOM troops carried out attack against AS controlled areas in Golweyn, Marka district.
06 November. A pastoralist from the Sa'ad clan was shot dead by militia from Omar Mohamud clan, at Xananbuuro village. The motive is suspected to be clan revenge.
06 November. Suspected al Shabaab fighters hurled a hand grenade at a residence of a traditional elder in Belet hawa town. No casualties reported.
06 November. An IED targeted a convoy carrying the Berdaale DC and administration members, near Jiiro Mad Sheeg. No casualties were reported.

assoc_actor_2: Government of Somalia (2017-) Puntland State; Unidentified Clan Group (Somalia)
notes: 06 November. A group of 5 armed men abducted the Puntland MP Omar Akabe, elected from Buhoodle, in Ayn in his car. Inter clan issues are said to be motive of abduction.
06 November. A man shot and killed a 25 years old female in the district of Hafatul Arab in Bossaso. The perpetrator was arrested.

04 November. 101 cases of rape were recorded in Somaliland between January and November 2018 (coded as one event per month); 105 individuals were accused of rape out of which 87 were arrested and charged.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
notes: 05 November. Unknown gunmen shot and killed a government soldier while he was driving a car at the outskirts of Muqdisho. They drove off with his car and AK-47 assault rifle.
05 November. Al-Shabab fighters attacked government soldiers at a restaurant in Mahaday district. Two soldiers were killed. A civilian also died in the crossfire.
05 November. Armed men opened gunfire against civilians sitting outside of a mosque in Elasha-Biyaha settlement, and killed one person. The motive was said to be clan retaliation.
05 November. Gunmen killed a businessman in a restaurant at Bar Ismal, Afgoye town. The cause is suspected to be clan retaliation.
05 November. Habar Yonis (Sacad Yonis) and Habar Jeclo (Biciido) militiamen clashed in the vicinity of Dararweyne. The cause and fatalities is unknown.
05 November. A man stabbed another man who was walking to his residence, in Garbahaarey town. Victim taken to hospital. Reasons unknown.
05 October. During a land dispute a group youths set a house on fire and killed a number of farm animals.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 05 November. Somaliland Army and Puntland forces exchanged artillery fire near the Tukaraq village. Casualties unknown.
04 November. Al-Shabaab elements attacked police forces at the livestock market, Heliwa district.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 04 November. Somali National Army and the Jubaland army killed six Al-Shabaab militants at Arara area.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
notes: 04 November. A Remote Controlled Improvised Explosive Device (RCIED) exploded at Somali special forces in Wanleweyne. The forces and Al-Shabaab fighters exchanged heavy gunfire. Four soldiers were killed.

assoc_actor_2: Habar Yoonis-Sacad Yoonis Sub-Clan Group (Somalia); Pastoralists (Somalia)
notes: 04 November. Gunmen from Habar-Jeclo/Biciido sub-clan reportedly killed a herder from Habar-Yonis/Sacad-Yonis clan in the area of Gadhka near Dararweyne village. Killing is suspected clan revenge.
04 November. Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a 16-year-old boy outside Idaale village after he refused to be recruited into the group.
04 November. An IED placed inside a charcoal sack in the kitchen of a small teashop at Bullo-Burte main market exploded. No casualties.
03 November. Unidentified assailants armed with pistolskilled one politician in Bakara Market of Mogadishu.
03 November. At least three people have been killed and several others injured in a roadside explosion in Somalia's capital Mogadishu.

03 November. Suspected clashes between armed freelance militias spotted in the town of Adado. Motives and casualitites unknown. The political stalemate between Galmudug opposing sides and the insecurity gave opportunity for freelance militias in Adado.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 03 November. AMISOM troops were attacked by a roadside explosion when travelling in Marka district. They exchanged gunfire with Al Shabaab militants in reaction after the explosion.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: 03 November. The US said it carried out a drone strike in Arare area, Lower Jubba Region, which killed four a Shabaab fighters.

03 November. A man with an intellectual disability from Reer Biciidyahan clan/Majeerteen was shot and killed by an armed man who hailed from Sa'ad clan/Habargidir on the outskirts of SW Galkayo. Motive unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 03 November. Unknown number of Jubaland Security Forces armed with AK47 rifles deserted from their units in Kismayo and moved towards Abdi Birole. Motive of desertion is unknown.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force; Labour Group (Somalia)
notes: 03 November. Puntland military soldiers from Tukarak frontline briefly occupied the Garowe International Airport to protest unpaid salaries for several months.
02 November. Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack overnight at a Somali Army base in the Huriwa district of Muqdisho Somalia.
02 November. A military convoy carrying reinforcements of Somali Govt troops in route to (Huriwa) struck a landmine leaving four soldiers wounded.
02 November. Joint Jubaland and Somali forces carried out ground operations against Al Shabaab at Arare area, Al Shabaab fighters retreated.
02 November. The Jubaland Intelligence and Security Agency found an IED which was planted in the middle of the road. IED was safely removed and some suspects arrested.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
notes: 02 November. Galmudug forces intercepted six lorries transporting weapons at Cadaado South Main Entry Checkpoint that was allegedly headed to Dhuusamareeb.

01 November. Somali forces and al-Shabab fighters clashed in Heliwaa District, Banadir Region. An explosion targeted the police station during the fighting. Four police soldiers were killed, and several others wounded. Casualties also on Al Shabaab's side.

01 November. Suspected AS fighters launched a hit and run attack against a SNA checkpoint at the Lafoole village neighbourhood in Afgoye District. Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire for about 10 minutes before the attackers retreated.
01 November. A local municipality tax collector was shot and killed in Jidkasodonka area along the main Bossaso highway. IS later claimed responsibility of the attack.

01 November. Three armed men carjacked a Toyota Landcruiser rented for an INGO (Save the Children) at Caska area, in North Galkayo. The owner of the vehicle and the hijackers were from theOmar Mohamud clan, with a personal dispute.
01 November. Clan militias who hail from Sa'ad sub-clan of Habargidir blocked the main road linking Galkayo and Adaado with stones demanding the release of Sa'ad Pirates in Garowe prison.
01 November. Two IEDs exploded on the road that leads to a cemetery located in the outskirt, west of Bullo-Burte District after two civilian vehicles passed overthem.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 01 November. In Jamame District 10 al-Shabab fighters were killed in an operation conducted by Amisom troops and Jubbaland forces.
01 November. A vehicle exploded in a Dacad Garage near Dayax Hotel in Waaberi District after an UVIED fixed to the vehicle detonated.
31 October. Al-Shabab gunmen shot and killed am SNA soldier at Elasha-Biyaha neighbourhood, Afgoye district. They also took his AK-47 rifle.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 31 October. A group of Al-Shabab fighters attacked AMISOM troops at Danow, Qoryoley district. The two allegedly exchanged gun fire before the attackers were forced to withdraw.
31 October. Al Shabaab fighters hijacked a vehicle that was transporting medical supplies from an NGO from Baled Hawa district to Garbaharrey District at Tulo burwaqo village.
31 October. A group of construction laborers demonstrated peacefully against their employers over contracting foreigners. The demonstration took place in front of Sahil Governor Office.
31 October. A roadside blast by AS targeted Somali National Army convoy travelling between Wanleweyn and Afgoye town, Lower Shabelle. The security forces opened fire after the explosion.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 30 October. Thousands of Ethiopian troops were deployed in the border town of Balanbale, in Central Somalia for unclear reasons.
30 October. At least six tribal elders killed over clan feud including 3 from same family at Lafole, outside Mogadishu.

30 October. Armed men reportedly clan militia shot and killed an old man at Daleeley settlement approximately 5 Kms north east of Adale district. The motive behind this killing is related to clan conflict in the area.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 30 October. SNA and AMISOM joint forces recaptured the SNA base in Daynuunay village without resistance after AS fighters withdrew from the location. SNA forces withdrew from Daynuunay base on 20 October due to insufficient logistic supplies.

30 October. About 40 ISIS fighters including foreigners armed with AK 47 weapons were sighted at Lasqorey area in Sanaag South West of Bossaso. They are suspected to have arrived from Yemen using a small vessel.
30 October. Residents of Bondhere district protested at Daljirka Dahsoon monument against the planned demolition of business kiosks in the district, disrupting transport. Police cleared the protest.
30 October. Suspected Al Shabaab men shot and killed a woman near the livestock market in Berdale neighbourhood of Baidoa.
29 October. Unidentified armed men, suspected to be AS Amniyats, shot and killed SNA soldier in front of Alberri Hospital in Dayniile District. The perpetrators stole his AK 47 and escaped.

On 29 October 2018, a male university student was shot and killed by uniformed government soldiers after they attempted to rob his friend of a mobile phone at the centre of Garowe town (Garoowe, Nugaal). The perpetrators were arrested.
29 October. Al Shabaab shot and killed a well-known businessman at Bakara Market in Howlwadag district.
29 October. A government soldier shot and killed another soldier near Villa Gaanshandhiga neighbourhood in Deynile District over an unclear argument.
29 October. Two groups of SNA soldiers clashed at Gololey village in Balcad district after a disagreement over the area checkpoint. One soldier was killed while another was wounded.
29 October. Al Shabaab gunmen armed with pistols shot and killed a senior commander of the government forces in Sinka Dheer village. They also took his AK47 rifle.
29 October. A SNA soldier who recently defected in Baidoa was assassinated while travelling to Burhakaba, at Mooda village.
29 October. Unknown assailants hurled a hand grenade at Ex-Control Afgoye in Deynile district. The forces shot towards different directions after the blast.
29 October. An unknown warplane conducted an air strikes at Ceeldheer village. The target was a hidden al Shabaab base in that area.
29 October. A RCIED, targeting SNA travelling within Oodweyne Village in Deynile district, detonated. The security forces responded with gunshots.

28 October. Unknown armed assailants shot and killed a civilian man in Ceelasha-Biyaha Settlement in Afgoye district. Reports indicated that the man openly criticized a religious sect in a local Masjid before he was shot by the attackers .

28 October. Unknown attackers, believed to be AS elements, hurled a hand grenade at police forces on foot patrol at Ex-Daallo Black Sea neighbourhood in Hodan district. One police officer was injured in the explosion.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 28 October. Landline explosion targeted Ethiopian military convoy on a routine rotational deployment at El-Gal village near Beledweyne. Al-Shabaab claimed killing 30 soldiers in the attack. It is not confirmed.
28 October. Galjecel and Shan Caleemod clan militias clashed at Wanleweyne town and at the outskirts of the city allegedly over farm ownership. Seven militiamen were killed.
28 October. Somaliland police arrested around 116 (mostly youth) people in several districts of Hargeisa region as part of a security operation.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 27 October. Clashes broke out at Farjano village in Kismayo between Jubaland forces and newly recruited soldiers sent in to reinforce security in the region after they allegedly killed an elder. The suspects were later arrested.
27 October. A gathering of people from all parts of the community, as well as SSPF from Hudur town, staged a demonstration against the President of South West State.
27 October. Demonstration in Adado over disagreement with the Constituent Assembly (particularly the president and Iskashiag newly elected MPs).
27 October. A dozen soldiers among new military recruits hired to strengthen the security of the region killed an elder in Kismayo.
27 October. Government forces clash with al Shabaab in the district Hoden Seybiyaano junction region of Mogadishu.
27 October. At least one person was killed and two others were injured in a landmine blast in the port city of Kismayo.
27 October. Police forces and SNA clashed at Seypiano neighbourhood in Hodan district over road access. There was an exchange of gunfire.

27 October. Unknown assailants hurled a hand grenade at a government troop position at Ex-Milk Factory neighbourhood in Hodan district. Security forces shot at different directions after the explosion. There were no reports of casualties.
27 October. SLP and armed civilians clashed at Erigavo town. The incident occurred after SLP arrived with a warrant of arrest for an individual who sold khat.
27 October. A civilian man hailing from Hawadle clan was shot and injured by a member of the Hawadle clan militia near Somtel office neighbourhood at Kooshin village in Beletweyne.
27 October. Unknown armed men shot and killed a journalist of a local radio at Elasha-Biyaha settlement in Afgoye district.

27 October. About 300 people protested against the conference of the Federal Member States held in Garowe on 23 October. The protesters chanted slogans against the agenda of the conference and pledged loyalty to the Federal Government.

27 October. A demonstration was held in Baidoa against the intervention of the Federal Government in the upcoming South West State presidential elections. The demonstrators burned tires along the roads. The police stifled the protest and arrested the main organizers and journalists.

26 October. A driver was killed, and his vehicle was stolen by al Shabaab fighters at the vicinity of Belethawa town. The driver was offloading sacks of khat in Garbaharrey and was on his way back to Belet-hawa district when AS fighters, on a motorbike, ambushed his vehicle.
26 October. Somalia troops and militias loyal to a former Somaliland deputy army commander clashed in Dararweyne. There were no reports of casualties.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 26 October. Government and Amisom troops retreated from the village of Fiidow in Middle Shabelle Region after capturing it a few days before. Government and Amisom troops captured Fiidow from al-Shabab on 23 October, which was under the group's control since 2015.
26 October. Unknown clan militia killed a civilian Civilian in Kooshin neighbourhood following a dispute suspecting him of being a criminal or insurgent.

26 October. A driver of a vehicle was shot and killed near Bixin Bridge. The suspect, who hails from Majeerteen sub-clan of Reer Mohamud, escaped from the scene. The deceased hailed from Dhulbahante sub-clan of Hayaag.
26 October. Two groups of SNA soldiers clashed at Zone K neighbourhood in Hodan district. There was an exchange of gunfire due a dispute between two SNA groups.One soldier was killed.
26 October. The security guard of Bayern Munich (Gurow) Hotel shot and killed his drunk fellow guard as he attempted to stop him in Horseed neighborhood of Baidoa. Suspected clan link.
26 October, on or before. A body was found in the area of Afgooye. Perpatrators, motive and exact date of death not known.
25 October. A civilian man from Roxanweyn sub-clan was shot and killed by unknown assailants in Netco area of Bossaso. The assailants subsequently escaped from the scene.
25 October. SNA forces, while on security operation, clashed with al Shabaab fighters near Eel-Leheli village. There were no reports of casualties.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 25 October. AMISOM confirmed the killing of the Chief Finance Controller of al Shabaab in an ambush in Barrire village.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 25 October. A commander, a chief finance controller of Al Shabaab and head of the Zakat tax collection in Lower Shabelle region were killed after AMISOM troops ambushed a venue of an Al Shabaab meeting in Bariire.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: 25 October. A US air strike killed two al-Shabab fighters and destroyed a vehicle near the southern Somalia village of Kunyo Barrow in Lower Shabelle region.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: 25 October. the Djiboutian troops have been deployed to the Jalalaqsi district while the Burundi troops arrived in Jowhar. The government and African Union forces have largely withdrawn from Al-Shabaab areas, and recently the government forces backed by Basra villages.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 24 October. A group of al Shabaab fighters attacked AMISOM and Somali government troops positioned outside Qoryoley town in Lower Shabelle. There was heavy exchange of gunfire, and AS were forced to withdraw from the area.
24 October. Unidentified armed man suspected to be al Shabaab militants using a pistol shot and killed a teacher of a Quranic school while in his residence at El - Hindi neighbourhood of Merka.
24 October. Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against an SNA position in Qansax-Dheere district. One SNA soldier was injured in the attack.
24 October. AS fighters fired three mortar shells in Galgala village of Galgala Mountain. There were no immediate reports of damages or injuries to people, and no arrests made.

24 October. An IED placed by the roadside, targeting an SNA vehicle, exploded near Dhanaane settlement in Marka town. Five soldiers were killed, and four others were injured. The blast damaged one of the SNA vehicle. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the attack.
24 October. Government soldiers opened fire on a pair of bandits in the Bakara market in Muqdisho Somalia, leaving one dead and another wounded.
24 October. Somali National Army (SNA) killed four al-Shabab militants including a senior commander and recovered weapons during a military operation in Lafoole, Bakool region.
24 October. Armed attackers shot and killed a civilian man at Bakara market in Holwadag district. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
24 October. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the IED attack in Wadajir, which has injured several Somali military soldiers.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 23 October. Government and Amisom troops captured the village of Fiidow in Middle Shabelle Region from al-Shabab. It had been under the militants' control since 2015.

23 October. A peaceful demonstration against the clan clash in Dhamay was organized by women in Lasanod. The demonstrators took to the streets and called the warring clans to have an immediate ceasefire and resolve issues in a peaceful manner.
23-24 October. Two Dhulbahante sub-clans (Baharar and Qayaad) clashed at Dhammay village. Forty people were killed over two days of violence (spready over 2 events), and 80 others were injured.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 23 October. Fighting has erupted in areas around Jubba junction in Mogadishu between two groups of Somali forces -police and officers of the National Intelligence and ecurity Agency [NISA] after an argument. One NISA officer was killed.
22 October. Al Shabaab fighters killed one civilian man and abducted two others in Daynuunay village. Al Shabaab fighters suspected the victim of spying for the government.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 22 October. Ethiopian forces of the AMISOM allegedly beat a civilian in Bardea, leaving him injured.
22 October. Unknown armed attackers shot and killed a civilian man working at a garage in Black Sea junction in Hodan district. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 22 October. Al-Shabab fighters and Somali government forces, backed by Ethiopia troops in the region, have clashed in areas of Hudur, Bakool region. The commanders added that government troops are now in control of the areas where the fighting happened, and that al-Shabab fighters have been pushed out.

21 October. Al Shabaab fighters attacked militiamen of a religious sect named 'Takfiir', at Mushaani Village (possibly Al-Takfir wal Hijrah). Seven militiamen were killed while two others were wounded.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 21 October. A UPDF patrol destroyed an IED placed at the Beled Amiin crossroads. No casualties were reported.
21 October. Al Shabaab fighters captured Daynuunay village from the SNA.

21 October. Local residents of Faxfaxdoon village staged a demonstration against AMISOM KDF contingent based in the village. Additional report indicated that locals denied the troops access to the water points located in the village.
21 October. Unknown assailants hurled a grenade at Bondhere Police Station in Bondhere district. The Police shot at the suspected location of the attack.
21 October. Armed attackers, believed to be al Shabaab, shot and killed an employee of a commercial company at Hawo Tako village in Wadajir district.
21 October. Unidentified gunmen killed a civilian in the Xamar Weyne district. Motive unknown.
21 October. The Southwest [state] regional administration minister accused the Somali government of deploying security forces and sending in weapons to Baidoa town. It is not confirmed.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Dervish Force
notes: 20 October. Darawish security officers staged a demonstration because of non-payment of their salaries for two months.

20 October. Unidentified armed militia and police forces clashed at Siliga village neighbourhood in Wadajir district. Five civilians and one police officer were killed while five other civilian bystanders were injured.
20 October. SLP arrested an unspecified number of elders from Mohamoud Haybe district. They were accused of illegal nomination of a new mayor and deputy mayor of their district.
20 October. Suspected al Shabaab elements shot and killed a civilian man in Marka district. The perpetrators escaped.

20 October. Macawisley-Hawadle militias and al Shabaab fighters clashed in Dib-Ugal village in Hiiraan (approx. Coordinates used based on location 05 km east of Moqukori village). One clan militia was killed, and two other al Shabaab fighters were seriously wounded.

On October 20, Al Shabaab fighters took control of Daynuunay village, Bay region after Somalian forces withdrew from the village. The control of the village changed hands on several occasions during the week.
20 October. Two men armed with pistols shot and killed two school principals at the livestock market in Heliwa district. They then stole mobile phones and computers from the victims.

October 24 (week prior). Somali intelligence officials say the deputy leader of an Islamic State-affiliated extremist group based in northern Somalia has been killed in the capital. Mahad Moalim's body was found near a Mogadishu beach last week, a few days after he reportedly was abducted while secretly visiting the city.
20 October. A man armed with a pistol shot and injured a young man at Ansaloti Market in HamarJajab district. The motive behind the murder was unknown.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: On October 20, Puntland security forces closed a road that links to the office of region's president in Garowe town of Nugaal region demanding for payment of their unpaid salaries for seven months.
20 October. In the Yaqshid District of Banaadir Region, two male teachers have been killed by gunmen.

On October 19, Somalian Military Forces opened fire on a minibus in Heliwa area of Mogadishu. One female passenger was killed while six others were injured. The motive behind the incident was unknown.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: On October 19, Al Shabaab militants clashed with AMISOM troop position at Embareso neighborhood in Baraawe town, Shabelle region.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: On October 19, Al Shabaab militants clashed with an AMISOM position at Danow settlement near Marka town, Shabelle region.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: On October 19, a remote explosive planted by Al Shabaab targeted AMISOM troops near Barawe coastline exploded in Baraawe town, Shabelle region. No reports of casualties.
On October 19, Kenya Defense Forces fighter jets conducted bombardments in Geriley town of Gedo region targeting Al Shabaab positions. No information on casualties or damage.
On October 19, at least three people, all civilians, were killed and several wounded in an airstrike carried out by unidentified warplanes in Bula-Hajji town of Lower Jubba region.

On October 18, Al Shabaab attacked Somalian Forces SNA forces based in Daynuunay village. There was an exchange of gunfire after which Somalian forces retreated from the village. Al Shabaab took control of the town. It was reported that reinforcements Baidoa arrived at the Somalian base and took back the control of village without any resistance.

On October 18, Al Shabaab attacked Somalian Forces SNA forces based in Daynuunay village. There was an exchange of gunfire after which Somalian forces retreated from the village. Al Shabaab took control of the town. It was reported that reinforcements Baidoa arrived at the Somalian base and took back the control of village without any resistance.
On October 18, Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at Bakara market, Hawl Wadaag, Mogadishu. One civilian bystander was killed while four others were injured.
On October 18, a woman was killed in Huriwa (Dahabshill Huriwaa) area of Mogadishu while going to a wedding after a gunman opened fire, allegedly a government soldier.

On October 18, Somalian forces and Al Shabaab fighters clashed in Giriley town of Gedo Region. Air strikes were involved in the battle. Residents of the town reported two civilian fatalities and some injured.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: On October 17, Al Shabaab militants reportedly attacked a Puntland forces base in Af Urur village, Iskushuban, Bari region. A soldier was seriously wounded during the attack.

On October 17, Al Shabaab attacked a Kenyan Military convoy travelling from Faafax Dhuun village to Geriley town, Gero region. There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which AS retreated. One Al Shabaab fighter was killed.
On October 17, Al Shabaab attacked Somalian Military Forces in Afgoye town, Shabelle region. Clashes occurred but no information was given on casualties.
On October 17, Al-Shabab fighters in Bay Region took control of a Somalian Military forces base in Deynunay village after Somalian forces left the base as the militants advanced to it.

On October 17, Somalian Forces clashed with unknown armed militia near IDP camp in the third section of Kahda, Banadir region. The incident occurred during a distribution exercise of food cards. One civilian was killed, and two others were injured.

source: Undisclosed Source; Radio Kulmiye; Garowe Online
notes: On October 17, local residents in Fafahdun (Faafax Dhuun) village, Gero region reported that Kenyan Military forces stormed houses after a roadside bomb attacks targeting them near the village, leaving 3 brothers killed and 4 injured. Some reports claimed that Kenyan Forces fired to prevent further attack after the roadside bomb and civilians were killed by stray bullets.

On October 17, after a brief ambush by Al Shabaab militants, a roadside bomb planted by Al Shabaab targeted a Kenyan military convoy between Faafax Dhuun and Geriley town, Gero region, causing unconfirmed casualties on the soldiers.
On October 16, Al Shabaab killed one of the elders who was involved in the election of current members of Somali parliaments, in Mogadishu's Wadajir area.
On October 16, Somali military forces conducted security operation along the river side near Basra town in Shabelle region. Some militants fired mortars at the SNA.
On October 16, AS fighters ambushed two donkey carts that were carrying food commodities near Walaq village and abducted two people owning the carts, near Wajid town, Bay region.
On October 16, a police officer shot and injured a civilian man in Afar irdoodka, Baidoa, Bay region. The incident occurred after the victim defied orders to stop his car.
On October 16, Al Shabaab ambushed a vehicle which was transporting khat at Jaldesa, 42km east of Dhobley town, Jubbada Hoose (approx coordinates used). The driver of the vehicle was killed.
On October 16, six civilians were abducted from Qoryoley town in Lower Shabelle region. It was suspected that Al Shabaab militants were behind the kidnapping.

On October 16, five police officers were attacked by hawkers using sticks in Berbera, Woqooyi Galbeed region. The attack was believed to be about the destruction of illegal structures by local municipalities with the support of the police.
On October 16, a group of Al Shabaab fighters attacked Somalian Security Forces in Jowhar town of Shabelle region. One soldier was killed while another was wounded in the attack.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: On October 16, Al Shabab attacked Somali and US forces passing near Basra village in Lower Shabelle region.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 15 October. NISA officers arrested Shaafi Raabi the Secretary of Somalia's Chamber of Commerce and Chairman of Jubaland's Chamber of Commerce in Waaberi. Reason for the arrest is unknown.
A spike in violence and insecurity in Somalia in October has forced more than 21,000 people to flee their homes in the country, particularly from Lower Shabelle region.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: October 15 (on or around) the US Military Forces carried out airstrikes in cooperation with the Somali government and killed four Al Shabaab militants in the vicinity of Araara near Jamame, Jubbada Hoose.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 15 October. Local traders attacked 5 SLP officers at a teashop. The motive may relate to recent demolition of illegal structures in the town.

15 October. SLP in Hargeisa conducted a security operation targeting youngsters suspected of creating unrest in Mohammad Haybe district. An unspecified number of youth gangs were arrested by the police.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: On October 15, an IED targeting an Ethiopian military convoy moving from Baidoa to Buur-Hakaba exploded at Mooda-Mooda village near Baidoa, Bay. There were no reports of casualties or damages.

notes: On October 15, an explosive planted by Al Shabaab militants destroyed the vehicle of a military convoy carrying Ethiopian forces outside Bur Hakaba (Buur Xakaba), Bay Region. Casualties were reported by Al Shabaab but unclear if any fatality.

On October 15, an IED placed beside the road detonated against Somalian Military forces while transiting through Gasarta village, close to Baidoa town, Bay region. One SNA soldier was killed, and six others were wounded.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: On October 15, a firearm belonging to a Jubaland soldier was accidentally discharged and injured a woman and her child at Dalxis (Dalxiiska) village in Kismayo town.

04 November. 101 cases of rape were recorded in Somaliland between January and November 2018 (coded as one event per month); 105 individuals were accused of rape out of which 87 were arrested and charged.

On October 15, a police officer shot and killed a civilian man at General Da'ud Section in Hamarjajab (Xamar Jaabjab), Mogadishu, Banadir. He opened fire to disperse the crowd gathering during a dispute between the victim and another. Police officer escaped the scene.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: On October 15, a US drone reportedly bombarded Koban village (Kobon, Jamaame) in Jubbada Hoose. Al Shabaab claimed that 10 Jabaland soldiers were killed.

On October 15, Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNA forces based in Daynuunay village, Bay region. Somalian Military forces were overpowered and retreated from the village after heavy clashes. Al Shabaab took control of the village. One soldier was killed. Somali Army reported to have killed 8 Al-Shabab fighters and injured several others.
On October 15, one Somalian soldier was killed and seven were injured after Al Shabaab attacked them on the outskirts of Bar Sanguun village near Kismayo, Jubbada Hoose.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: On October 14, An AMISOM Uganda night patrol was ambushed by Al Shabaab in Marka town of Shabelle region. One soldier died and a civilian also lost life in the cross fire exchange. 11 militants were also reported to be killed. This event is believed to be distinct from earlier clashes in the town.

On October 14, an IED, targeting an SNA convoy, exploded near Basra Village, Middle Shabelle region. Two soldiers were killed while four others were injured. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the attack.
On October 14, people from Baidoa staged a demonstration in support of the victims of the Al Shabaab suicide attack in the town the previous day.

On October 14, an RCIED, planted in a residence structure, exploded in Belethawa (Belet Xaawo) town. The target was believed to be Celi Dhere sub clan elders meeting inside the residence. There were no reports of causalities.
On October 14, a group of youth stoned the security forces manning the Zoobe junction, in Hodan district. The security forces fired warning shots to disperse the crowd and injured one civilian.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: On October 14, Al Shabaab ambushed and killed six AMISOM Burundian soldiers outside of Marka town, Shabeellaha Hoose. The Burundian soldiers were sent as reinforcements to Somalian Forces during clashes with Al Shabaab in Marka town (coded in a separate event).
On October 14, fighting between Kenyan Military and Al-Shabab fighters was reported in El Wak (Ceel Waaq) district of Gedo Region.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: 13 October 2018: The US Africa command announced an airstrike targeting Al-Shabaab militants in Hardere town that killed at least 60 militants.
13 October 2018: Al-Shabaab militants abducted 4 elders from Aad and El Abdi villages, Mudug region, for not paying Zakat taxes.
13 October 2018: Al-Shabaab militants abducted 4 elders from Aad and El Abdi villages, Mudug region, for not paying Zakat taxes.

13 October 2018: A suicide bomber detonated himself in a busy cafe in the town of Baidoa, resulting in the death of 23 people (24 with the bomber) and the injury of 70 or more. Al-Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 12 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attacked an AMISOM troop base near the KM60 village neighborhood, Afgooye. Troops clashed with the fighters for about 30 minutes after which the perpetrators withdrew.
12 October. Muktar Robow's militia ambushed Al Shabaab insurgents near Bana village. After the clash Robow's militia retreated to Xudur. Casualties unknown.
12 October 2018: A Somali National Army soldier shot and killed a civilian man near Digfeer Hospital in Hodan district
11 October 2018: A remote controlled explosive device went off as a Somali National Army convoy passed through Garas-Baley area of Daynile, Mogadishu. One vehicle was damaged, no casualties reported.

11 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attacked a Jubaland police post in Diff village (c. 65 km north of Dooley town), sparking armed clashes. The Al-Shabaab fighters managed to take control of the post after only a few minutes of fighting, withdrawing a few hours later. No info on casualties.
11 October 2018: A tax collections officer was shot and killed at Bossaso Main Market.
11 October 2018: Garwaale and Eelaay clans clashed in Maaranka (c. 07 km north west of Baidoa) over a land dispute. Five (05) people were killed. Approximate coordinates used.
11 October 2018: Al-Shabaab executed 5 people, including one 16 year old boy, in Sakow town, middle Juba. The victims were accused of providing information to the Somali army.
11 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attacked Somali National Army soldiers in Shalambod town, sparking an exchange of gunfire. No info on casualties.
11 October. Gunmen killed a pastoralist in Daaru-Salaam. Motive unknown.
11 October 2018: An unidentified warplane conducted an airstrike raids on Al-Shabaab/local meeting positions in Kibis village. No info on casualties.

11 October 2018: Unidentified warplanes conducted an airstrike raid against Al-Shabaab targets in Kukuma village (c. 30 km south of Ceel Waaq district, approx. Coordinates used). One civilian was injured in the strike. Approximate coordinates used.

11 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters attacked Somali national soldiers in the Mahaday district (c. 26 km from Jowhar town). Al-shabaab fighters took control of the town, only to withdraw several hours later. Two government soldiers were injured.

assoc_actor_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 10 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters conducted a late-night attack against Somali soldiers and allied AMISOM troops (Identified by the source as Ugandan) in Qoryooley District in Lower Shabelle. No further info.
10 October 2018: Somali National Army forces claim to have taken control of Gawaan village (BAY) after clashing with Al-Shabaab fighters in the area. No info on casualties.

notes: 10 October 2018: An explosive device set near the road exploded as a convoy of Djiboutian AMISOM soldiers traveled near Buur Weyn. At least one vehicle was damaged in the attack, with some injuries suspected. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

notes: 10 October 2018: Somali National Army troops and allied AMISOM forces have taken control of Buurweyn, Dibileey, and Faahaale villages in Jalaqsi district after Al-Shabaab fighters withdrew.

notes: 10 October 2018: Somali National Army troops and allied AMISOM forces have taken control of Buurweyn, Dibileey, and Faahaale villages in Jalaqsi district after Al-Shabaab fighters withdrew.

9 October 2018: Residents of Wanla Weyne town protested the killing of a former Al-Shabaab member by military special forces. Protests were also held in Buur Weyne (coded separately).

9 October 2018: Police forces shot at demonstrators in the Burweyne village in Wanlaweyn district. Protesters were denouncing the killing of a well-known shiekh in the town by Somali security forces the day before. Two of the protesters were injured.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)

9 October 2018: Clan militiamen gathered to stand and protest a man who lost his job with a private security company providing services to the UN in North Gaalkaco. Local authorities later came to resolve the issue.
9 October 2018: Abgaal clan militiamen killed an unarmed civilian from Hawadle clan and injured two others, in Bulacle area. Clan rivalry has been going on for some time over a grazing dispute.

9 October 2018: Al-Shabaab executed four former fighters and one civilian in Jilib, all accused of providing intelligence to foreign intelligence agencies.

9 October 2018: Attackers believed to have links to Al-Shabaab threw a hand-grenade at Somali National Army soldiers in Shalambot town in Marka district. Troops reacted with gunfire. Three civilians were wounded by either the gunfire or the grenade (unclear).
09 October. Armed men belonging to the Sa'ad clan shot dead a civilian from the same clan over personal disputes in Gaalkacyo.
9 October 2018: Unidentified warplanes conducted an airstrike in Ceel Caade targeting an Al-Shabaab vehicle garage.
9 October 2018: Unidentified persons fired an RPG rocket into the house of a Somaliland army commander in Ceerigabo No casualties reported.

8 October 2018: Unidentified armed men shot at a civilian vehicle in northern Galkayo town, injuring him severely. The victim later died in a hospital. Motivations are unknown.
8 October 2018: Two transport cooperatives shot at each other at Lowyacado in Adwal region over a business dispute. Police later intervened to break up the fight.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces

8 October 2018: Local security forces in Ceel Bard killed two Somali National Army soldiers who refused to surrender their weapons to them. Two other SNA soldiers were arrested.
07 October. A 14-year-old girl was hospitalized at Lasanod Hospital after being sexually assaulted. The perpetrator has not been caught.

7 October 2018: Unidentified armed men ambushed a civilian vehicle in Jilable village vicinity, Mudug, injuring 4 people. Other sources have claimed that the event ended in the death of 5 civilian passengers.

7 October 2018: A group of Al-Shabaab (AS) fighters attacked a checkpoint manned by Somali soldiers in Mukayga area of Afgoye town, Lower Shabelle region. The AS fighters retreated after a short exchange of gunfire.
7 October 2018: An IED planted near a checkpoint in Ambareeso area in Barawe town exploded, injuring one soldier.

7 October 2018: Unidentified armed assailants shot and killed two bus conductors at Bakara market intersection in Hodan district. Later reports suspected the perpetrators of having links to Islamic State.
7 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters claim to have killed 5 Somali National Army soldiers in an ambush carried out as the soldier's convoy travelled through the Jazeera area of Mogadishu.
6 October 2018: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at police positioned at Black sea area in Hodan district.

6 October 2018: AS militants ambushed an SNA convoy travelling from Mogadishu to Merka at Gendershe village vicinity in Merka district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes. . One SNA senior officer was killed while three others were injured.

5 October 2018: Suspected AS militants ambushed a public minibus carrying khat from Jowhar to Jalalaqsi between Ceel-Baraf village and Jalalaqsi vicinity in Mahaday district. 5 October 2018: An Al-Shabaab fighter was shot and killed with his own pistol after engaging in a fight with some youth in the Sagalaad village, Afgooye district. Approx location given.
5 October 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters killed three people between Ceel Baraf and Cali Foldhere and took cattle.

1 October 2018: The Police Commissioner of Deynile district attacked locals constructing a tarmac road in Garasbaley village in Deynile district. The group providing security at the construction site (identified as also a government police force) exchanged gunfire with officers of the Police Commissioner. One soldier was killed and a civilian was injured.

1 October 2018: Somali National Army soldiers claim to have killed 5 Al-Shabaab fighters during clashes in Jamaame district. Local commanders claim to have taken control of Bangini, Mana Mofo, and Kobon, all in the Jamaame district. Fatalities spread across the three locations.
1 October 2018: An explosion of unidentified origin targeted Somali National Army soldiers in Wanla wayn, killing 2 and wounding 2 others.
30 September 2018: Al-Shabab fighters killed a Somali soldier and injured two others in Bar-Sanguuni, just outside of Kismayo.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 30 September 2018: Joint Somali and Amisom clashed with Al-Shabaab fighters in Ber Hano (Beerxaano) and other villages on the outskirts of Belet Weyne. No info on casualties.

30 September 2018: Protesters took to the streets of Diinsor town in protest of Muqtar Robow's possible candidacy for the upcoming South West State presidential election. Muqtar Rabow is a former member of Al-Shabaab.
29 September 2018: A group of fishermen gathered to protest a land dispute. Police forces dispersed the protest peacefully.
29 September 2018: Police and gunmen identified as drug-gang members engaged in a shootout in Garowe, resulting in the death of a civilian bystander and the wounding of two police officers.
29 September 2018: AS fighters detained more than ten civilian residents of Bu'ale town including a former humanitarian personnel.
29 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters took control of Dhagahow, Yaaqle and Kooreebe settlements under Balcad district after government troops vacated from those settlements.

29 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters threw a hand grenade at soldiers in the Tadamun village in Afgoye town. Soldiers opened fire in response, but no one was injured.
29 September 2018: A South West State Police officer shot and wounded the driver of a minibus in Buur Xakaba following a dispute involving taxes.
28 September 2018: Unidentified gunmen shot dead a businessman on the outskirts of the Beledweyne town.
28 September 2018: An AS member killed three fellow AS fighters in Ceeel Dhuun Adeegow (c. 47 km north west of Baidoa) after a dispute over taxes collected from the local community.
28 September 2018: At least three AS militants were killed in an airstrike near Jilib village (Shabeellaha Hoose) conducted by anti-Al-Shabaab forces.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration

28 September 2018: Unidentified gunmen killed a university student in Mogadishu.

27 September 2018: Somali National Army soldiers claim to have killed 16 Al-Shabaab fighters in clashes with the militants in Jilib village, Marka. A foreign fighter from Afghanistan was among the dead.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force

27 September 2018: An IED reportedly exploded near the AMISOM base in Hawl-wadaag village (Mogadishu), targeting a Somali National Army vehicle.
27 September 2018: Three police officers were wounded when an IED device they were disarming in the Bakara market detonated. No group has claimed responsibility.
27 September 2018: Two people were wounded during a conflict over land that was fought between two clan militias, Luwaay and Leysaan, in Towfiiq neighbourhood of Baidoa town.
27 September 2018: Three civilians were killed and 6 others wounded when an IED device exploded in a restaurant in Al-Waq town, Gedo. Al-Shabaab was blamed for the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 27 September 2018: Prison security officers in Bossaso staged a protest over a lack of salary by blocking movement in and out of the prison. Puntland security forced responded with gunfire, sparking clashes. 1 prisoner and 2 civilians were killed by stray bullets, while 2 police officers and 2 more civilians were injured.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 27 September 2018: Suspected Al-Shabaab fighters shot and killed an off-duty NISA official near the Abdalla and Awareere Masjid areas of Wardhigley neighborhood in Mogadishu.

26 September 2018: Police forces opened fire on a deaf civilian who failed to follow police commands in the central market of Bossaso town, Bari region. The victim was hospitalized following the event.
26 September 2018: Police forces shot and injured a man at the main roundabout in Garowe town.
26 September 2018: Al-Shabaab linked militants ambushed a convoy carrying khat in Mooda Mooda village, Bay region. 2 Somali National Army soldiers who were escorting the convoy were wounded.

26 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters abducted 4 civilians near Baadcade village (approx. 10km NW of Baidoa, approximate coordinates used). The civilians had allegedly broken an Al-Shabaab imposed ban on cell phones and tobacco in the area.

25 September 2018: A report issue by Garawe online stated that a bomb attack hit a police checkpoint in Afgoye town, lower shabeelle, killing one police officer and wounding 2 others. Al-Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack.
25 September 2018: Unidentified armed men shot and a killed Somtel Telecommunication company employee near Masjid Hareed neighbourhood, Howlwadag district.
25 September 2018: 5 people including a woman, boy and one of five armed men were injured by security forces  after a gunfight erupted over a land dispute in Israac village in North Galkayo.

25 September 2018: Al-Shabaab fighters ambushed two donkey carts that were carrying food commodities and other materials near Walaq village, SW of Wajid town. Two people were killed and the food supplies were burned.

25 September 2018: An improvised explosive device targeting Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers exploded in Marka town. Al-Shabaab militants and the soldiers exchanged gunfire following the explosion. One soldier was killed and a second wounded. Al-Shabaab forces claim to have killed 5 soldiers in the event. Fatalities coded as lowest estimate.
25 September 2018: Government forces manning Bar-Smail checkpoint opened fire on a vehicle carrying khat in Afgoye town. The driver was killed and a passenger wounded.

24 September 2018: A total of 35 al-Shabab militants were killed and several others wounded after clashes in Qoriyole between Somali National Army troops and Al-Shabaab forces. At least one Somali soldier was killed as well during the gunfight.
24 September 2018: A vehicle rigged with explosives exploded in Afgoye, Dharkenley district. Unknown perpetrator at time of reporting.
24 September 2018: A Somali National Army (SNA) soldier shot dead an armed thief who tried to rob him in Yaqshid district, Mogadishu.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 24 September 2018: Unidentified militants opened fire on the security convoy of President Abdiweli Mohamed Ali as it passed through Bossasso, leading to the death of one soldier and the wounding of two civilians. Brig Farah Galangoli, who was in charge of security in Nugal region was dismissed following the incident. Islamic State has claimed responsibility for the attack
24 September 2018: A ciilian man was reportedly shot and wounded by a police officer when he failed to obey instructions near the Masjidul Rahma, Bari region.

24 September 2018: Al-Shabaab shot dead  three truck drivers in Waro-rako grazing area (C. 25km south east of Hoosingo village, approx. coordinates used). 4 other truck drivers were injured by the militatants. Sources suggest that the drivers may have been involved in charcoal trade, which is currently banned by Al-Shabaab.
24 September 2018: Two police officers conducting route safety were shot dead by unidentified armed men near Gaaca area, a village in Bossasso. A passenger was also wounded.
24 September 2018: Unidentified armed men riding a motorcycle shot and killed two electoral delegates male and female at Ceel Qode and Daahisoy villages, in Afgoye town.
