On 29 July, two SNA soldiers were reportedly injured by suspected Al-Shabaab militants during an exchange of gunfire near a checkpoint in the Lafoole village neighborhood, Afgoye. Two soldiers were reportedly injured in the attack.

On 29 July, suspected Al-Shabaab militants shot and killed a police officer at the Bakara Market Qudaarta section in Hodan district, Moghadishu. The police officer was armed and on duty at the time of the attack.

On 29 July, Islamic State gunmen claim to have shot dead a financial officer in the Bakara market, Moghadishu. Al-Shabaab gunmen reportedly killed a police officer in the same area, on the same day (event coded separately).

On 29 July, armed men reportedly linked to Al-Shabaab attacked a checkpoint manned by Somali National Army soldiers at the Milk Factory village area in Hodan district, Mogadishu. The militants withdrew after a 20-minute gunfight. Casualties are unknown.
On 29 July, a man was reportedly executed by Al-Shabaab militants in Sakow town, after confessing to having poisoned a boy and his father using rat poison.

On 29 July, an IED attached to a private vehicle detonated at the Galmudug village, Wadajir district. The driver of the car was killed (presumably a civilian) and three SNA soldiers were injured. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: Non-violent activity: On 29 July, the National Intelligence and Security Agency operating largely in Mogadishu was dissolved and merged with the regular police force.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: On 29 July, armed fighters with links to Al-Shabaab reportedly raided an AMISOM military base in Arba'ow area near Elasha Biyaha village, just outside of Mogadishu. No info on casualties.

On 29 July, Al-Shabaab fighters claim to have seized the town of Saateelow in Gedo Region. According to the source, Al-Shabaab-linked militants launched an attack on Somali national Army forces' barracks before sweeping to take control of the town. The source did not provide any information on casualties.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: On 28 July, Al Shabaab militants reportedly conducted a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM Burundian troops based at Arbacow (15 KM west of Moghadishu) in Afgoye district. RPG, mortar, and gunfire lasted for around 30 minutes after which Al-Shabaab militiamen withdrew. No injuries or fatalities were reported by the source.
27 July. Al Shabaab carried out an attack on an SNAF checkpoint. After a brief exchange of fire the insurgents withdrew.

On 28 July, two groups of SNAF soldiers reportedly clashed over khat related matters near the Jazeera road, Wadajir district, Moghadishu. One civilian was killed in the exchange of gunfire by stray bullets.

On 27 July, two groups of SNAF soldiers, divided along clan lines, reportedly clashed at Hanta Dheer, 77 area in Dayniile district over a land dispute. Three people were injured, including two SNAF soldiers. Some other source have reported 5 deaths in the incident, 4 of them soldiers, and at least 7 civilians wounded.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: On 27 July, a former QRF commander and deputy police commissioner of Puntland was shot and killed by men armed with pistols in front of the Dulqarney Mosque in Israac Village, North Galkayo region in Mudug. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the shooting.

On 27 July, South West Police Forces (Military force of Somalia) reportedly attacked an Al-Shabaab position near Lafaale village (located 37 KM south-west of Wajid). Two Al-Shabaab fighters were killed in the resulting firefight, after which the remaining Al-Shabaab fighters fled.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: On 27 July, two remotely detonated explosive devices reportedly targeted an AMISOM (unidentified country of origin) convoy at the Ilbaq settlement near Gololey village in Balcad district. Gunfire reportedly followed the the explosions. Al-Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the attack. No casualties were reported.
27 July. Somali soldiers killed six al-Shabab militants and injured several others during an operation near Wajid, at Lafale location.

On 26 July, a cameraman working for a media company was reportedly shot and killed by an armed government soldier in Suuqa Beerta vicinity, Waberi district. According to the report, the shooting came after a dispute over road access. The soldier fled the scene after the incident.
On 26 July, a man specified as being from the Ali Saleeban sub-clan was shot and seriously wounded in a mosque near Netco area of Bossaso. Al-Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the shooting.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Police Force
notes: 26 July. Unidentified gunmen assassinated Puntland Police Colonel Abdirashid Hassan Hashi 'Gabi Gabi' after Isha prayers.
On 26 July, Kenyan Soldiers (KDF) reportedly raped 5 women who were living near the Belet Xawo town located near the Kenya/Somalia border. All 5 were later hospitalized in Kenya.
26 July. Unidentified gunmen assassinate a solider and two police officers between the Dabka junction and Bakara Market, specifically in the Barmudo neighbourhood in Hodan District, Banaadir Region.

On 26 July, unidentified armed men shot and killed a former legislator at his house in the Al-Hindi village, Hawl Wadaag district. The attackers reportedly escaped. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

On 26 July, suspected Al-Shabaab militants shot and killed two local policemen in Barmuuda village, Howlwadag. It is unclear if the police officers were on-duty at the time, however, the source did clarify that they were both armed. A later attack targeted military personnel at Bar-Ubah junction road.

On 26 July, unidentified armed men believed to be linked to Al-Shabaab reportedly shot dead two SNA soldiers at the Bar-Ubah junction road in Hawl-wadaag district. It is believed that the soldiers were on-duty at the time of the attack. An earlier attack had targeted police personnel in Barmuuda village of Howlwadag.
26 July. A man identified as a Spouse to a Somalia MP has been assassinated in Hawlwadag district of Mogadishu. Perpetrators and their motive not known.

26 July. Armed al-Shabaab fighters shot and wounded an official working for the Puntland administration in Bosaso town, Bari Region. A separate source later specified that the incident occurred in the Tuurjale area located south east of Bossaso; and specified that the official was a customs officer from the Ministry of Finance.
26 July. A driver was gunned down in Mogadishu's Wabere district by Somali soldier, over dispute unknown reason, the criminal escaped the scene.
26 July. Unidentified gunmen in the Showriyada neighbourhood of Dharkenley District severely wounded a [former] electorate college delegate from the Southwest State.
26 July. An unidentified gunman assassinated a journalist in Xamar Jaabjab. Dalsan Radio report the perpetrators were government soldiers.

On 26 July, one soldier was killed and two others injured when an argument broke out between a group of SNAF (Somali National Armed Forces) soldiers near Jayga - Kawo Godey village neighbourhood in Dharkenley district in Mogadisho. According to the source, a heated argument broke out over khat, and later escalated to gunfire.
25 July. Two soldiers were killed in clashes with an unknown actor near Tarabunka junction in Mogadishu.

25 July. An RCIED, targeting an SNA technical vehicle travelling in the Warabale area, exploded outside of Wanleweyn district. At least five soldiers were killed and five others were injured. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility of this attack.

25 July. It was reported that al Shabaab fighters placed six magnetic IEDs on Solar Electric poles in Hawlwadaag neighbourhood located west of Beletweyne town. According to SPF EOD team, all six IEDs exploded. There were no reports of casualties but all six electric poles were destroyed.
25 July. An al Shabaaab IED targets a Somali military truck travelling between Afgooye and Wanlaweyne. 10 deaths reported.
25 July. An IED targets a military vehicle at Ceelasha Biyaha. Islamic State later claimed responsibility.
Weapons seizure: 25 July. The Somali army intercepted a vehicle carrying a large number of al Shabaab heavy weapons and confiscated its contents in Baardheere.
25 July. Government forces carry out an anti-al Shabaab operation in Diinsoor. Two al Shabaab captured, one soldier wounded.

24 July. Kenyan defence forces were reported to have destroyed a communication mast in Samaroole, about 18 kilometres away from the border town of El-Wak, reason unknown. Two of the mast's security guards were killed in the attack.
24 July. Unidentified gunmen fired on an SNAF convoy escorting General Anod as it passed an SNAF checkpoint. At least 1 soldier was killed in the clash.

24 July. Militias from the al-Shabab group tried to attack bases belonging to Somali National Army command in Middle Shabelle Region, particularly in Qalimow area, between Jowhar and Bal'ad Districts but were repelled by the army. 'Heavy casualties' were inflicted on the militants. In a conflicting report, it was asserted that al Shabaab took over the area without resistance. After remaining al Shabaab fighters attempted to flee, air forces from unknown origin (likely US) struck the retreat position, killing 'many' and destroying two vehicles.

24 July. Reports from the Sanaag region say that fighting between Habar Jeclo and Habar Yonis occurred in the Ceerpitey district (coordinates approx), 70km south of Erigavo. clan-based militia that caused death and injury - numbers not known.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
notes: 24 July. Militias from the al-Shabab group tried to attack bases belonging to Somali National Army command in Middle Shabelle Region, particularly in Qalimow area, between Jowhar and Bal'ad Districts but were repelled by the army. 'Heavy casualties' were inflicted on the militants. In a conflicting report, it was asserted that al Shabaab took over the area without resistance. After remaining al Shabaab fighters attempted to flee, air forces from unknown origin (likely US) struck the retreat position, killing 'many' and destroying two vehicles.
23 July. Gunmen assassinated Isma'il Iriri the former Head of NISA in the Waaberi district. Gunmen fled.

23 July. Suspected al Shabaab militants shot and killed an SNA soldier and injured another at Macmacaanka village neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape after the incident. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the attack.
23 July. Al-Shabaab grenade attack on SNAF checkpoint. Casualties unknown.

23 July. Gaaljecel militias abducted a civilian from Jajeele clan as part of a dispute over 4 missing camels which is under discussion between the 2 sides. Influential clan elders from Galjecel clan attempted to free the abducted man.

23 July. Al Shabaab attacked Sanguuni Forward Operating Base (FOB). Two VBIED approached the check point in front of the FOB but was repulsed by soldiers and exploded. A third VBIED destroyed the checkpoint. Causalities not listed.

23 July. An armed SNA soldier using an AK47 shot and killed a male driver of a rickshaw at Mac-Macanka village vicinity in Dharkenley district. The district police attended to the scene of the incident where the perpetrator was shot and killed. The motive behind the incident was a dispute over extortion money.

23 July. Al Shabaab attacks a military base in Bar-sanguni, leading to a battle lasting over an hour. Causalities on both sides - VOA report, later in the week, per a military source: 'We have lost six fighters; our forces were successful in defeating al-Shabab in this operation, and we have killed 87 militants.' Later reports indicate that government forces captured a number of al-Shabaab controlled villages, including Arare.
23 July. Government forces captured a number of al-Shabaab controlled villages in Kismayo, including Arare, following a heavy AS attack on a military base in Bar Sanguini.

23 July. Al Shabaab attacks and overtake a Somali military base at Baarka (coordinates approx), 50km of Kismayo. Al Shabaab claims 27 SNG fatalities. The remaining soldiers retreated and fled toward Bulogudud.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: Defusal: 22 July. Jubaland security forces received information indicating that there was a suspicious vehicle, model Toyota Saloon, parked in the vicinity of Shagalaha Village. Upon arrival at the scene, JISA personnel managed to conduct a thorough search of the vehicle and managed to find an IED which was left inside the vehicle underneath the rear passenger seat. The said IED was safely removed from inside the vehicle. Security forces are reported to be conducting an investigation to establish the motive behind the reported incident.
22 July. Al Shabaab attacks a group of soldiers with a grenade in the Arra Gudud area of Kismayo. Three soldiers reported dead.

22 July. SNA soldiers on reconnaissance mission clashed with al Shabaab fighters near Warshiidle village (c. 12 km north east of Moro Gabey). Two al Shabaab fighters were killed and one SNA soldier was injured. The injured SNA soldier was transported to Hudur for further medical treatment.

22 July. A group of al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against Kenyan police reservists at the borderline of Kenya and Somalia (c. 02 km south west of Belet Xaawo town). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for a few minutes after which al Shabaab retreated. There were no reports of casualties.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 22 July. Al Shabaab militants travelling in four small boats along the coastline conducted an attack against AMISOM/SNA troops at Barawe Seaport neighbourhood in Barawe district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for over 30 minutes after which al Shabaab retreated. Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

22 July. Armed clan- based militias (not identified) using AK47s shot and killed a civilian man in his home at Buurdheere village (c. 15 north of Cadale) in Cadale District. The motive of the killing was reported to be clan feuds over disputed land. The perpetrators managed to escape.

22 July. An 18-year-old boy was abducted by al Shabaab militants near Camaara village in south Mudug. It was believed that the motive behind the incident was recruitment to al Shabaab militants. Many families fled with their children from the area for fear of al Shabaab conscription.

22 July. Al Shabaab fighters abducted about 26 civilians from Abaqsole village (c. 20 km east of Garasweyne village). The arrest was in relation to the armed confrontation between SNA and al Shabaab fighters earlier that day near Warshiidle Village. Al Shabaab accused the civilian of collaborating and providing information to SNA soldiers. Al Shabaab fighters took the detained civilians to Garasweyne village (c. 48 km north west of Xudur).

22 July. An IED targeting SNA forces manning a makeshift check point near Baddi Cadde village (c. 08 km West of Baidoa) exploded while SNA soldiers were screening a rickshaw. One civilian was killed and three others consisting of two SNA soldiers and a civilian were injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 22 July. Jubaland forces carried out a security operation against al Shabaab insurgents in Badhaadhe. Authorities claimed to have killed 6 insurgents including a senior commander Shurem Adan Ali.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 22 July. Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNA troops based in Jazeera Beach neighbourhood in Wadajir district. The clash was initiated with an RPG followed by heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw. Two NISA soldiers were killed while two others were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab group could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.
22 July. A soldier is killed in an al Shabaab attack in Xudur.
22 July. Approximately 70 NISA officers protested near Villa Somalia after they were fired on orders of FGS due to equipment issues.

22 July. An SNA soldier, in military uniform, shot and killed a civilian minibus driver at Suuqa Kaaran neighbourhood in Kaaran district. Two civilian passengers were injured. The driver was killed after he refused to pay 5000 Somali shillings to the soldier. District police arrived at the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrator managed to escape.
21 July. Military forces destroy an al Shabaab communications network during a raid. Weapons recovered, arrests made. There may have been a violent clash; causality numbers not known.

21 July. Habargidir and Hawadle clan militias clashed at Baanyaaley (c. 76 km north east of Beletweyne) at the border of Matabaan and Mahaas districts. Six clan militias were killed and 20 others were injured from both clans. The clash is a continuation from the previous day.
21 July. Two soldiers are confirmed wounded following an al Shabaab bomb attack in Bulo Nuriyo neighbourhood. The detonation took place during the nighttime hours.
21 July. An IED targeting a senior police officer detontes in Mogadishu's Forilow area, killing a civilian bystander. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
21 July. Islamic State fighters shot and killed a man in his shop at the Bakara Market in Hodan district.
21 July. A government official is killed and his brother injured after a bomb that was fitted to this car detonated in Bondere District. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

21 July. An RCIED, targeting a Toyota Pickup carrying police officers, exploded while the vehicle passed near Tabeelaha Weydow neighbourhood in Dayniile district. One civilian bystander was killed while two others, including one police and a civilian, were injured. The injured were taken to the hospital for treatment. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 20 July. Al Shabaab gain control of Af Urur after Puntland forces stationed there flee. No reported violence.

20 July. Two unidentified armed men shot and killed a government police officer while on his way home near Suuq-bacaad market vicinity in Yaqshid district. The perpetrators managed to escape. The district police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. ISIS claimed responsibility for the attack.

20 July. Habargidir and Hawadle armed clan militias, while on foot patrol, clashed at Baanyaaley (c. 76 km north east of Beletweyne at the border of Matabaan and Mahaas districts). Two clan militiamen from Habargidir clan were killed. The motive behind the clash was related to disputed grazing land. Further reports indicated that the two clans were mobilizing their militias for a potential armed clash.

Movement of forces: 20 July. Nearly 13 battle wagons with unspecified numbers of troops from SNA were deployed in Karin-dabaylwayn (c. 75 km south east of Lasanod district) in response to hit-and-run attacks conducted by Puntland against Somaliland military in Tukaraq area.. The reinforcement troops were initially based at Kalabaydh village.

20 July. Armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab fighters, shot and killed a businessman in a shop at Cilmi-Loos area of Kooshin neighbourhood located east of Beletweyne town. The victim was an electoral delegate who participated in the elections at Hirshabelle parliamentarians. Local security forces arrived at the scene of the incident where they conducted a search operation around the incident area. Four suspects were arrested in the operation.

20 July. Suspected al Shabaab fighters burnt two Toyota Noah vehicles, allegedly headed to Wajid town near Ideed Hoosle village (c. 25 km south east of Wajid). The two drivers managed to escape from the suspected al Shabaab fighters but one was injured. The motive behind the incident was unknown.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 20 July. An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy from Afgoye, exploded at Lanta Buuro village vicinity. The AMISOM lead battlewagon was damaged. There were no reports of human casualties. The unidentified perpetrator managed to escape.

assoc_actor_2: Habar Yoonis-Sacad Yoonis Sub-Clan Group (Somalia); Women (Somalia)
notes: 20 July. A three-year-old girl was shot and killed by armed men from Biicido clan. The armed men attacked a house that belonged to Sacad Yonis clan in pursuit of the occupants but they were not found.
19 July. Al-Shabab's fighters carried out a special operation in Qoryoley town in Lower Shabelle Region [southern Somalia] killing two soldiers from the Somali government. Several others wounded.
19 July. Suspected al Shabaab gunmen open fire against a vehicle transporting Khat. Driver injured. The assailants escaped with the vehicle.
19 July. Suspected al Shabaab shoot and kill a military officer in Heliwa.

18 July. A government soldier shot and killed a civilian minibus conductor at Ex. Control Balcad in Heliwa district after a dispute over extortion of money. The perpetrator was not apprehended by the security forces.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 18 July. A NISA (Alpha Group unit) convoy from Gubadley headed to NISA headquarters shot at a civilian truck carrying stones for building construction at Wajeer village in Kaaran district. The security forces suspected the vehicle to be a VBIED. One civilian male porter was killed while another was injured and rushed to Hospital for medical care. The convoy proceeded to the NISA HQ. Government forces arrived at the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests.
18 July. Al Shabaab fighters kidnapped three village chiefs from Shatilow, Cadaley (coordinates approx) and Barkale villages (coordinates approx) (c. 15 km north west of Luuq District).
18 July. Al Shabaab fighters kidnapped three village chiefs from Shatilow, Cadaley (coordinates approx) and Barkale villages (coordinates approx) (c. 15 km north west of Luuq District).
18 July. Al Shabaab fighters kidnapped three village chiefs from Shatilow, Cadaley (coordinates approx) and Barkale villages (coordinates approx) (c. 15 km north west of Luuq District).
18 July. Militiamen hailing from Saad attacked and injured two Majeerteen khat sellers in Gaalkacyo.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 18 July. Armed clan militias from Saad shot at a joint military force checkpoint at the main market area. There was an exchange of gunfire. There were no reports of casualties. It was believed that the perpetrators are supporters of the dismissed commander of the 21st battalion of Somalia military forces based in Dhusamareb town. Galmudug security forces in South Galkayo arrested three perpetrators and four others escaped from the area.

18 July. Two suspected al Shabaab elements shot and killed a soldier from the stabilization forces who control traffic at Bar Heydhaafin area in Hamarjajab district. The perpetrators managed to escape. The district police attended to the scene of the incidents but there were no reports of arrests.

18 July, on or about. Al Shabaab forced child soldier recruitment causes many residents to flee Cadale District during the week of 18 July. The development sparked off clashes between Al-Shabaab militias and the locals in Gullane and Kadere (coordinates approx) villages.

18 July, on or about. Al Shabaab forced child soldier recruitment causes many residents to flee Cadale District during the week of 18 July. The development sparked off clashes between Al-Shabaab militias and the locals in Gullane and Kadere (coordinates approx) villages.

18 July, on or about. Al Shabaab forced child soldier recruitment causes many residents to flee Cadale District during the week of 18 July. The development sparked off clashes between Al-Shabaab militias and the locals in Gullane and Kadere (coordinates approx) villages.

18 July. Two unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed an unknown young man at his shop at Ex. Control Afgoye neighbourhood in Hodan district. The perpetrators managed to escape. No group claimed responsibility of the attack.
17 July. A UVIED attached under a private vehicle detonated in Waaberi, injuring a female bystander.

17 July. Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNA troops based at Bar Jowhar neighbourhood in Heliwa district. The clash was initiated with hand grenade followed by an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes after which al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

17 July. Al Shabaab clashed with a clan militia at ILJI village (c. 05 km east of Mahadaay district). Three al Shabaab fighters and one senior al Shabaab amir were killed. The clash occurred after residents ignored al Shabaab orders to pay Zakawat (tax) on their properties including farms produce and other assets.

17 July. A hand grenade was hurled at an SNA checkpoint near Mukeyga SNA checkpoint in Afgoye district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire at the general direction of the attack. There were no reports of casualties and the perpetrator managed to escape. Perpetrator not identified.
17 July. Unknown armed men shot and killed a civilian man at Cirshiida village in Maydh district (c. 90 km north of Cerigabo). The victim was a resident of Cirshiida village.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 17 July. Puntland and Somaliland forces exchange artillery fire along the frontline near Tukaraq.
17 July. An elder who hailed from Qubays-Dir clan group was shot and killed by two unidentified gunmen on his way to the mosque in Gaalkacyo.

17 July. Two SNA soldiers and Mogadishu Stabilisation Mission Forces clashed at Towfiq junction road in Yaqshid district. The stabilisation forces tried to stop SNA their battle wagon at their checkpoint near Towfiq junction road for security check but the SNA personnel resisted the order. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes. Two SNA soldiers were killed while three others were wounded.
16 July. Somali police forces reacted with gunfire after a hand grenade was thrown at them by an unidentified armed group in Daynile.

16 July. Somali security officers were accused of deliberately shooting at civilians during a forceful eviction at Siinka Dheer neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. Dozens of Somali forces were deployed to Al Biri village near Siinka locality to demolish houses illegally built in the area. The security officers deployed in the area were confronted by residents protesting over the demolition of their houses. Three unarmed civilians were killed and five others were injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 16 July. Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNA troops based in Sifeynta Batroolka Factory neighbourhood in Wadajir district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw. Two NISA soldiers were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab group could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.
16 July. Al Shabaab militants killed a Somali police officer in Dharkenley

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 16 July. Suspected al Shabaab fighters attack a Jubaland position at Faafax Dhuun. Military commanders stated they suffered no causalities and were able to repel the attackers.
16 July. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the killing of a senior police officer in Yaaqshiid.
16 July. After a hand grenade was thrown at them, Somali police fired back at the unidentified attackers in Weeberi.

16 July. An unidentified warplane (likely either US or Kenyan) conducted an airstrike against an al Shabaab position at Xawaalaha Faranfarre grazing area (coordinates approx) (c. 85 km west of Beletweyne town). Additional reports indicated that the warplane targeted a meeting that was being chaired by the al Shabaab governor(waale) of Hiran Region. Casualties cannot be established at the time of reporting. Other reports indicated that three vehicles belonging to al Shabaab were destroyed. The situation in that area was reported to be very tense.
16 July. Al Shabaab attacks and killed a soldier in Jamhuriya neighbourhood of Karaan district.
16 July. After a hand grenade was thrown at them in Jowhar, Somali military forces fired back at the unidentified assailants.

04 November. 101 cases of rape were recorded in Somaliland between January and November 2018 (coded as one event per month); 105 individuals were accused of rape out of which 87 were arrested and charged.
15 July. Somali soldiers involved in land eviction operations in al Biri/Sinka Dheer open fire on people resisting the operation. Three civilians killed and five injured.

15 July. SNA troops and a group of suspected al Shabaab fighters clashed at Embareeso Village (c. 05 km north of Afgoye). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for over 30 minutes after which al Shabaab retreated. Mortar shells and RPGs were fired at the SNA bases. Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.

15 July. Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against an SNA checkpoint at Captain Las vicinity (c. 12 km north west of Merka district). SNA responded and the al Shabaab attackers were forced to withdraw. Two SNA soldiers were injured in the fight. Casualties from al Shabaab could not be established at the time of reporting.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 15 July. Suspected al Shabaab militants ambushed a small luxury vehicle carrying a senior SNA officer at Doonka village in Afgoye district. The SNA officer and his driver were killed in the attack. Reliable sources stated that the victim was the NISA commander of Afgoye district. The perpetrators took the vehicle of the victim and escaped. District Police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
15 July. Unidentified warplanes (likely US or Kenyan) conduct an airstrike against a group of HVT holding a meeting near Farxanne grazing area in the outskirts of Buq Koosar.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 15 July. Somaliland and Puntland forces clashed near God-Qabobe. There was an exchange of heavy and light artillery shelling which lasted for a couple of hours. The shelling landed in an empty place which resulted in no fatalities.

14 July. Between 2-3 al Shabaab fighters, driving cars laden with explosives, attempt to gain entry to the Presidential palace. The two automobiles detonated, along with an exchange of gunfire. Security forces shot dead the two perpetrators; a majority of sources claim 3 al Shabaab dead, six dead total.

14 July. Al Shabaab elements launch a complex attack against Villa Somalia. The attack began with a pair of car bombs, followed by a general attack on the entrance of the building. Al Shabaab claims 12 troops dead; military forces claim 10. The two attackers were suicide bombers.

14 July. Two fatalities have resulted from an attack on the home of a government official which occurred in Baidoa town. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility. Following the initial explosions, witnesses said grenades were thrown to a gathering of soldiers and officials. Five injuries.
14 July. Al Shabaab fighters attack a SNAF position near Embresso. The assailants were repelled after 30 minutes.

14 July. An IED, targeting a vehicle carrying the chairman of Awdiinle village, exploded at Awdinle Village (c. 30 km north west of Baidoa). The vehicle was slightly damaged by fragmentation of the blast. The chairman escaped unharmed. There were no reports of casualties. A second unexploded IED was discovered in the same area. Local police in the village safely detonated the second IED.
14 July. Heavy fighting between government forces and al Shabaab in Farhan, near Qoryooley. One al Shabaab fatality, several wounded.
14 July. Al Shabaab claims credit for assassinating a cleric in Ceelasha Biyaha.

14 July. 3 security guards were killed and 5 were injured after an attack on the home of a government official (the Daynuuay DC) which occurred in Baidoa town. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility. Following the initial explosions, witnesses said grenades were thrown to a gathering of soldiers and officials. Five injuries.

13 July. Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed an elderly religious man who was travelling in a public minibus from Mogadishu to Elasha at Tabeelaha vicinity in Dayniile district. Reliable sources stated that the victim was an electoral delegate who participated in the election of Members of Parliament in South West State. District police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

13 July. Al Shabaab members hurled a hand grenade at SNA soldiers near the residence of the Deputy Governor for Bay region at Bulo Jameeco area of Hawlwadag neighbourhood in Baidoa. The explosion injured four people consisting of three SNA soldiers and a civilian. One of the civilian victims later succumbed to his injuries at Baidoa General hospital. The perpetrators managed to escape from the area. There were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility of the attack.

13 July. An unidentified militiaman shot at a lorry full of commodities from Burco headed to Cerigabo at Karin-biyod near Elafweyn. The driver was slightly injured and the engine was damaged. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. Habarjeclo and Habaryonis sub clans denied responsibility of the incident.
13 July. At least one civilian has been killed and five others are wounded in a clash among soldiers organized along clan lines. The clash was motivated by land.
13 July. Al Shabaab fighters attack 'apostate militias' (assumed to be government forces) manning a roadblock at Genberlawe, near Belet Weyne. One soldier reported dead.
13 July. Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate a Somali soldier in Dharkenley. The assailants escaped with confiscated weaponry.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 12 July. An RCIED exploded near the Livestock Market in Heliwa district. The RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy that was moving from Maslah to the stadium. The lead AMISOM vehicle in the convoy was damaged by the explosion. AMISOM soldiers shot towards several directions resulting in the death of three civilian bystanders and injuries to five others. Casualties from AMISOM could not be established at the time of reporting. The perpetrators managed to escape.

12 July. An unidentified armed man using a pistol shot and killed a civilian businesswoman in front of her house at Macalin Nuur village neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. The motive of the assassination was not clear and the perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. District police visited the scene and conducted a security operation.
12 July. A Leelka Case security guard posted at the Cagarweyne Hotel was shot dead by a suspected Dir gunman.
12 July. Unidentified clansman opens fire against a truck traveling from Burco to Ceerigaabo near Karin Kulan. The driver was injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 12 July. Armed clashes oppose Puntland and Somaliland forces near Tukaraq.

11 July. Kenyan air forces launch attacks at Jawari (Jawaare) rural area. Somali Memo, which is al Shabaab-backed media, reported that the strikes hit an area inhabited by herders. In a second report by Universal TV, the strikes were directed at an al Shabaab training camp at Hassan Kusow, which is near Jawaare. Somali National Army officials said the air strikes had killed at least eight al-Shabab militants and destroyed two vehicles, including armoured ones.
11 July. Unidentified gunmen assassinate clan elder Saeed Aware in Bossaso.
11 July. Hirshabelle soldier opens fire against a civilian pushing a donkey cart near Belet Weyne. Victim injured.

11 July. Southwest State and SNAF forces launched an operation against Al-Shabaab positions on the outskirts of Qansax Dheere. During the operation Southwest State claimed to have killed 3 and injured 4 insurgents.
10 July. Al Shabaab propaganda sources report Somali and Bancroft private forces killed a civilian and abducted three others in Wanlaweyne district. - not confirmed.
10 July. One civilian is dead in a dispute over land.
10 July. Suspected al Shabaab assailants hurl a hand grenade towards the SNAF checkpoint located in Buulo Folyo.
10 July. Al Shabaab burns houses in Aad village in apparent revenge after recent area clashes.

09 July. Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a municipal police officer and an SNA soldier at Suuq-Bacaad market in Yaqshid district. SNPF responded to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators had escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the incident.

09 July. Jijeele clan militias clashed with Gaaljecel clan militias protecting their herd of camels at Birbiriq area located at the outskirts of Beletweyne town. Gaaljecel clan militias retreated allowing Jijeele clan militias to steal the camels. The camels were taken to Doonkudle (c. 30 km North of Beletweyne town). The incident was related to ongoing clan feuds.

09 July. The Deputy Police Commander of Jalalaqsi Police Station shot and killed a man in Jalalaqsi town (c. 160 km south west of Beletweyne town). Subsequently, a relative of the victim stabbed and injured a relative of the perpetrator immediately after the incident at the same place. The injured civilian was taken to Mogadishu for medical treatment. Security forces managed to capture and arrest the first perpetrator. The incident was related to clan revenge.

09 July. The Deputy Police Commander of Jalalaqsi Police Station shot and killed a man in Jalalaqsi town (c. 160 km south west of Beletweyne town). Subsequently, a relative of the victim stabbed and injured a relative of the perpetrator immediately after the incident at the same place. The injured civilian was taken to Mogadishu for medical treatment. Security forces managed to capture and arrest the first perpetrator. The incident was related to clan revenge.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 09 July. Interim Juba Administration soldier fired on journalist Yahya Abdirisak Soofe. The journalist was not injured.
09 July. Suspected Al-Shabaab assassins have shot and killed a former electoral delegate in Bakaara Market.
08 July. ISIS gunmen assassinate two soldiers in Suuq Bacad. The assailants escaped with confiscated weaponry.

08 July. Al Shabaab elements, using pistols shot and killed a businessman in his shop located near Dhagaxtuur School at Dabka Junction Road in Howlwadag district. The district police attended to the scene of the incident and arrested several suspects. Reliable sources stated that the victim was part of the delegates of the electoral process in electing MPs in South West state.
08 July. Al Shabaab shells a Kenyan base with artillery fire at Faafax Dhuun. Al Shabaab claims 3 dead, including a senior officer.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 08 July. An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy headed to Jowhar town, exploded at Ilbaq settlement near Gololey village in Balcad district. It was report that two sequence explosions were heard followed by gunfire. There were no reports of casualties.
08 July. Unidentified assailants stab and kill a young civilian in Yaaqshiid's Dabageynka neighbourhood.

07 July. Suspected al Shabaab attacked interior and security ministries (near Villa Somalia) with two large vehicle borne suicide explosions. Following the initial attack, several fighters attempted to enter the buildings, but were repelled by security forces stationed at the entrances. The ensuing gun battle lasted two hours. 15 dead (at least 5 fatalities were al Shabaab), dozens injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 07 July. Puntland and Somaliland forces exchange artillery fire at Tuko Raq. Details limited.

07 July. An RCIED, buried along the roadside targeting a private luxury vehicle carrying a former District Commissioner of Qoryoley district, exploded in Barawe town, Barawe District. The vehicle was destroyed. The former District Commissioner and his staff (at least one) were killed. The perpetrator managed to escape and al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

07 July. Pro Puntland militia (not identified) ambushed and killed Taleh District Police Commissioner and wounded the Mayor of Taleh on the road from Tukaraq to Taleh districts in Sool region. Officials were on duty distributing humanitarian food supplies in that area.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 07 July. Jubaland forces ambush a group of al Shabaab fighters near Jamaame.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 04-06 July. Government soldiers of the Galmudug Administration (assisted by Ethiopia) clash with al Shabaab in the area at Caad between Adado and Xarardheere at Aad area. Between 15-17 soldiers dead over first two days, 1,500 civilians displaced. Al Shabaab claims 25 dead total over three days. Additionally, al Shabaab reportedly overtook Gabdhale village (assumedly on the final day) which was a central command for the Galmudug troops.

06 July. Al Shabaab overtakes Qaimow village following a clash with government forces. Preliminary reports say that at two soldiers were killed and a number of others were wounded in the fighting. Al-Shabab fighters took full control of Qalimow and hoisted the black flag bearing shahada [Islamic declaration of faith] at the village's checkpoint. Al Shabaab later left the village and government forces retuned, taking control without violence.

06 July. Al Shabaab overtakes Qaimow village following a clash with government forces. Preliminary reports say that at two soldiers were killed and a number of others were wounded in the fighting. Al-Shabab fighters took full control of Qalimow and hoisted the black flag bearing shahada [Islamic declaration of faith] at the village's checkpoint. Al Shabaab later left the village and government forces retuned, taking control without violence.

05 July. An RCIED, targeting SNA soldiers, exploded in the vicinity of Sii-Sii village in Dayniile district. One SNA soldier was injured. SNA soldiers responded with gunfire but the perpetrators managed to escape.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
notes: 05 July. Clashes between Galmudug soldiers and al Shabaab continue into the second day in Caad. Between 15-17 fatalities total.
05 July. Al-Shabaab gunmen assassinated Derow Dhakane Mohamed an electoral delegate from Jubaland near his home in Mogadishu.

05 July. Habarjeco and Habaryonis sub clans of Sacad Yogis' and Bicido clashed at Dararwayne Village (c. 49 south west of Elafwayn) at the outskirts of the Elafweyn district in Sanaag region. At least one person was killed and two others were injured.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 05 July. Reports indicated that the al Shabaab combatants attacked AMISOM and Government forces positions in Halane neighbourhoods, in Qoryoley District. The two sides reportedly exchanged gunfire for a couple of hours. Al Shabaab fighters were forced to withdraw from the area. At least three people including one soldier and two al Shabaab militants were reportedly killed in the clash.
05 July. Al Shabaab assassinates a Jubaland electoral delegate in Mogadishu.
05 July. A group of 3 men wearing SNAF uniforms abducted and raped an elderly female civilian from her home in Jowhar. The soldiers dumped their victim at the edge of town and fled.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 04-06 July. Government soldiers of the Galmudug Administration (assisted by Ethiopia) clash with al Shabaab in the area at Caad between Adado and Xarardheere at Aad area. Between 15-17 soldiers dead over first two days, 1,500 civilians displaced. Al Shabaab claims 25 dead total over three days. Additionally, al Shabaab reportedly overtook Gabdhale village (assumedly on the final day) which was a central command for the Galmudug troops.

04 July. Reports indicated that the Minister of Public Works & Re-Construction Engr. Salah Sheikh Osman survived an assassination attempt after his private vehicle was rammed into by another luxury car waiting outside the Minister's residence near Daljirka Dahsoon in Shangani District. This was followed by exchange of fire between the Minister's staff and the attackers. At least two civilian bystanders were killed while two others were injured. The motive and those behind this assassination attempt are not known.

04 July. Armed local militia from Xarardheere clash with al Shabaab at Caad. The clashes reportedly started when villagers refused al-Shabab demands to have the village's young men join the militant group. The clashes were ongoing at the time of reporting.
04 July. Al Shabaab forces shell a Kenya base in Faafax Dhuun. Causalities reported, though it is not yet clear how many Kenyan soldiers were killed (unknown coded as 10).

04 July. Two clan militias (not identified) reportedly clashed at Bacda village (coordinates approx), on the main MSR (approx. 25kms S of Matabaan). Both sides briefly exchange small arms fire which lasted for an hour. Two (2) clan militias were killed and five (5) others were injured in the armed confrontation. Information indicates that the incident is related to clan revenge and an ongoing hostility between the two clans over grazing land dispute.

04 July. Two clan militias (not identified) reportedly clashed at Xudeyle village (approx. 10kms SE of Matabaan). Both sides briefly exchange small arms gunfire. Three (03) clan militias were killed and two (02) others were injured in the incident. The armed confrontation is reportedly related to clan revenge and an ongoing hostility between two clans over grazing land dispute.

04 July. Al Shabaab elements reportedly attacked SNA troops position in Aliyaale village neighbourhoods, Balcad District. The SNA forces managed to fight off the attackers. As result, three civilian bystanders and one SNA soldier were injured in the clashes. Casualties from al Shabaab militants were not reported.

04 July. One female was killed when al Shabaab militants ambushed two vehicles carrying local people who fled from CAAD area after 4th July armed clash between al Shabaab militants and armed local residents. The ambush took place in the area between Caad and Camara villages on the night.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: 04 July. An IED reportedly planted by al Shabaab went off in the proximity of AMISOM (Djiboutian National Defence Forces) checkpoint in Jalalaqsi town. Information indicates that AMISOM forces were not at the checkpoint during the explosion. No casualty reported from the incident.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
notes: 04 July. Government soldiers of the Galmudug Administration clash with al Shabaab in the area between Adado and Xarardheere at Caad area. Clashes continued next day. Between 15-17 soldiers dead total

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Galmudug Administration
assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 04-06 July. Government soldiers of the Galmudug Administration (assisted by Ethiopia) clash with al Shabaab in the area between Adado and Xarardheere at Caad area. Between 15-17 soldiers dead over first two days, 1,500 civilians displaced. Al Shabaab claims 25 dead total over three days. Additionally, al Shabaab reportedly overtook Gabdhale village (assumedly on the final day) which was a central command for the Galmudug troops.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 03 July, on or before. An al Shabaab explosive targeted a AMISOM convoy travelling to Buufow from El Jalle. The vehicle was destroyed. Believed losses of lives - estimated at 10.

03 July. Reports state that a magnetic IED attached to a private luxury vehicle detonated at the Via Liberia (Allay) vicinity in Waberi District. Moments before, the owner of the car noticed the device and alerted the police EOD team. However, as EOD team arrived on the scene to inspect the vehicle, the IED exploded. No casualties were reported. Perpetrators not known.
03 July. Al Shabaab kills a civilian in Dharkenley during the evening hours.
03 July. Al Shabaab publicly executed a 93 year old elder over this participation in an election.
03 July. Three Somali forces are dead following an attack by al Shabaab in Baaki.
03 July. The Somali National Army (SNA) killed at least 20 al-Shabaab militants in a fierce fighting in Somali's southern village of Muse Haji in Lower Juba.

03 July. Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols reportedly shot and killed a businessman who was leaving the local mosque after afternoon prayers in Howlwadag District. The perpetrators managed to escape. District police attended the scene, but no arrests were reported.
03 July. Al Shabaab fighters attack a SNAF base near Qoryoley. Assailants repelled.

03 July. Local communities from North and South Galkayo protested due to high inflation and the devaluation of Somali shilling. Protestors complained of high prices of commodities and urged the government administration to look into the issue.
02 July. Six police officers are dead in an IED explosion near Bakaara Market. Islamic State claimed responsibility.

02 July. Reports stated that a government soldier shot and killed a Tuktuk driver at the Seybiano village neighbourhood in Hodan District. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The motive of this shooting is unknown. The family of victim are reportedly seeking justice for their family member from Government.
Agreement: 02 July. Ali Abdullahi, al-Shabab commander in charge of Hajji Muse area in Lower Juba region surrendered to the government forces during a joint operation in the town of Bar-Sanguun.

02 July. Reports state that the RCIED explosion targeting SNA Vehicle passing near Howlwadag junction road detonated at the Howlwadag junction road in Howlwadag District. The device reportedly missed its target and caused no casualties.
02 July. At least two people injured in landline explosion near cinema Nasri in Hodan district. Perpetrators not known.
02 July. Two injured in explosion from IED fitted to a car in Sinai road area of Mogadishu, Wardhigley. Perpetrators not known.
02 July. A car bomb detonates near Kalkal Hospital in Hodan. Several injured. Suspected Al Shabaab attack.

assoc_actor_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 02 July. A senior Somali regional district official stated that AMISOM and government forces have captured an Al-Shabaab commander during a joint security operation on the outskirt of Qoryoley town. Other militants also arrested.

02 July. Two groups of SNAF engaged in exchange of gunfire in the vicinities of the El-Baraf village (approx. 35 km North East of Mahaday district). The soldiers divided along clan lines (namely Hawiye/Agbaal sub clans) clashed over Mira Kat related matters. One sub clan militia was killed while two others were injured during the exchange.

02 July. Al Shabaab reportedly shot and killed a famous clan elder in public square in the centre of Gamboole. Reliable sources stated that the victim was part of the electoral delegates who participated in MPs elections in Hirshabelle state in 2016.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 02 July. Puntland and Somaliland forces reportedly exchanged artillery rounds in the Frontlines of Tuka-Raq and God-Qaboobe bases. Both troops accused against each other of instigating the fighting. There were reports of casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 02 July. Puntland and Somaliland forces reportedly exchanged artillery rounds in the Frontlines of Tuka-Raq and God-Qaboobe bases. Both troops accused against each other of instigating the fighting. There were reports of casualties.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 02 July. Armed clashes oppose Jubaland troops to al Shabaab fighters between Muse Haji and Aryaale bridge.
01 July. UVIED planted under a civilian vehicle detonates near Sinai Junction. Two civilian bystanders were injured.
01 July. MoSF soldier manning a checkpoint in Sey Biano opens fire against and kills the driver of an auto-rickshaw.

01 July. IED detonates in vicinity of the al Nasri Cinema on Banadir Junction. The IED targeted a vehicle owned by Galmudug President Haaf and driven by his wife. One of the wife's sisters was injured by the blast.

01 July. A roadside IED detonates against a SNAF convoy on Hawl Wadaag Junction in Mogadishu. The device misses its intended target. No casualties were reported. The Islamic State claimed responsibility shortly after the incident.

01 July. At least five civilians were killed and more than 10 others wounded after al-Shabab militants fired mortars in a residential areas of Wadajir. The target of the attack may have been a nearby AMISOM base.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 01 July. A Jubaland soldier shot and killed his fellow soldier over land disputes at new Kismayo area in Farjano vicinity of Kismayo town.
01 July. Al Shabaab execute a clan elder in Ceel Gamboole.

01 July. Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack on SNA troops based in Buulo-Folyo village vicinity, in Afgoye District. Al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw after about 20 minutes of fighting. No casualties were reported from SNA soldiers and casualties from al Shabaab group could not be confirmed.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 01 July. An al Shabaab IED targets a ENDF convoy outside of Baidoa.
30 June. Islamic State claims to have killed two civilians in the capital on 30 June.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 30 June. Al Shabaab attacks a AMISOM-Uganda base at K60. Fighting was reported as 'heavy.' Causalities reported.

30 June. Governor of Lower Shabelle Mohamed Ibrahim Barre and a district official escaped with minor injuries after an IED blast targeted their vehicle at Weydow (Ceelasha Biyaha area) outside Mogadishu. A bodyguard was also injured.
30 June. Al Shabaab fired heavy shells at UN personnel at Mogadishu airport. Three civilians injured in nearby residential areas.

30 June. The newly appointed Lower Shabelle governor, Mohamed Ibrahim Barre was slightly wounded after Remote Control Improvised Explosive Device (RCIED) targeted his convoy at the Tabeelaha Weydow neighbourhood, in Dharkenley District. One soldier was killed while three others including Elasha Biyaha settlement woman Chairperson sustained injuries and was rushed to Madina Hospital for further treatment. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 30 June. Three AMISOM-Uganda are dead following an al Shabaab IED blast in Golweyn.
30 June. Three civilians and a government soldier wounded in grenade attack at Bar Ubah junction, Hawl Wadaag. Perpetrators not known.
Security measures: 30 June. Security forces block roads and add security in Mogadishu as a measure to curtail possible violence leading to the Somali Independence Day on 01/07.
30 June. An election elder, Ibrahim Ali Hassan, is assassinated in Dharkenley. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

30 June. Al Shabaab forces attack government troops in Qoryooley. Area residents heard an exchange of gunfire, which continued for a considerable amount of time, with government troops suffering casualties. Details of the casualties were not immediately available. Al-Shabab fighters captured two motorcycles.

30 June. Habar Jeclo-Ahmed Farah militia attacked a police transport en route to Ceel Afweyn. The police were transporting a prisoner who was one of their clansmen. Both sides exchanged gunfire. Three SLP and local two militiamen were injured.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: 30 June. IED targets Djiboutian convoy in Jalalaqsi.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 30 June. Puntland and Somaliland forces exchange artillery fire along the frontline near Tukaraq. No casualties reported. The chain of events that led to the skirmish is unknown.

29 June. SNA and al Shabaab fighters clashed and exchanged gunfire at Buufow bacaad. Al Shabaab elements took control the town while SNA soldiers withdrew. However, one hour later SNA troops with re-enforcement recaptured the town from al Shabaab militants without resistance. At least two SNA soldiers were killed while three others including two civilian bystanders were injured.

29 June. SNA and al Shabaab fighters clashed and exchanged gunfire at Buufow bacaad. Al Shabaab elements took control the town while SNA soldiers withdrew. However, one hour later SNA troops with re- enforcement recaptured the town from al Shabaab militants without resistance. At least two SNA soldiers were killed while three others including two civilian bystanders were injured.
29 June. Somaliland forces clash with local militia. One Somaliland soldier and three civilians are killed during the incident.

29 June. Southwest Special Police Forces shot and killed a rickshaw (Tri-cycle motorbike) driver near Abag Tag village (approx. 25kms SW of Diinsoor district), while reportedly passing through a route previously banned by SWSPF. Al Shabaab fighters had instructed the local transporters to use this route (banned by SWSPF) to prevent Southwest Administration to generate income from the transporters.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: 29 June. UPDF logistics convoy travelling between Beled Amin and Buulo Mareer is hit by a roadside IED. One Caspir APC damaged and two UPDF injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 29 June. Jubaland foot patrol targeted by a roadside IED between Sunguuni and Musa Haji. One Jubaland soldier was injured by the blast.
29 June. Al-Shabab militants using explosives reportedly blew up one of the canal bridges linking Qoryoley town to Danow and Shalambod during the evening hours.

29 June. Al Shabaab, armed with pistols shot and killed two police men (Municipal unit) while collecting revenue at the Afarta Jerdino junction road in Bondheere district. The perpetrators managed to escape after incident.
29 June. IED targets the convoy transporting Governor of Lower Shabelle Mohamed Ibrahim Barre. One person was killed and seven soldiers injured.
29 June. Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols assassinate a civilian in Dharkenley.
29 June. A suspected al Shabaab militant hurled a hand grenade towards a MoSF checkpoint at Bar Ubaax Junction. A Somali soldier and three civilians were injured by the blast.

29 June. Unidentified men armed with pistols reportedly shot and killed a University student at the Elasha Biyaha neighbourhood, in Afgoye Corridor. The victim was shot as he emerged from business shop going to his vehicle. The District Police attended the scene but no arrests were made. The perpetrators escaped in the victims' private vehicle.

29 June. Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack on SNA troops based in Heliwa's Livestock Market neighbourhood. Al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw. No casualties were reported from Government soldiers. Casualties from al Shabaab group could not be confirmed.
29 June. Islamic State claims responsibility for the killing of two civil servants in Mogadishu. The location of the attack within the city is not known.
28 June. Alleged Islamic State gunmen assassinate two Somali tax collectors at Afarta Jardiino Junction. The assailants escaped with confiscated weaponry.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Intelligence Agency
notes: Security measures: 28 June. Puntland regional admin has merged two security agencies - Puntland Intel Agency (PIA), and Puntland Security Service (PSS) to create one big agency known as the Puntland Intel and Security Agency (PISA). Move comes after recent sacking of intel and security chiefs.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: 28 June. A Djiboutian convoy was struck by an IED in the outskirts of Jalalaqsi. Incident initiated a larger al Shabaab ambush. The resulting casualty figures are unknown.

28 June. Reports indicated that the al Shabaab fighters carried out an attack on the SNAF troops based in the outskirt of Qoryoley town (approx. six km North East of the town), Qoryoley District. The fighters exchanged gunfire with the SNAF for over an hour and briefly seized part of the SNA base, but later withdrew. Two (2) SNAF soldier and four (4) al Shabaab militants were killed while one SNAF Toyota battle wagon was destroyed.

28 June. Clan militias (not identified) shot and killed a civilian man near Coomaad village (approx. 45kms N of Beledweyne town). The incident is reportedly related to clan revenge and an ongoing hostility between two clan over grazing land dispute.
28 June. A female journalist is assassinated by suspected al Shabaab gunmen near Dabka Junction, Hawl Wadaag.
28 June 2018: A member of Somali National Army was killed by unknown gunmen in the Sinay Junction area of Yaaqshiid district (Mogadishu). It was suspected that the gunmen were members of Al Shabaab.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 28 June. Sporadic exchanges of fire between Puntland and Somaliland forces at Tuko Raq. Locals report 'full scale clashes.'
28 June. Unidentified gunmen assassinate a university student in Ceelasha Biyaha.

28 June. Al Shabaab attacks and takes over a Somali military base at Bilal (Baasl) area on the outskirts of Marka town. Somali forces fled the location after al Shabaab began opening fire on the location.

28 June. Reports indicate that an unidentified gunman armed with a pistol reportedly shot and killed a civilian businessman inside his shop at the Siinaay Market neighbourhood, in Bondheere District. The perpetrators managed to flee the scene. District Police visited the scene and conducted security operations to no avail.
28 June. A female journalist is assassinated by unidentified gunmen near Dabka Junction, Mogadishu.
27 June. Local militiamen loyal to Puntland raid a Somaliland Police station in Laascaanood and liberate an undetermined number of inmates. The assailants escaped.
27 June. Clan gunmen assassinate a civilian in Coomaad. The killing is linked to an ongoing land dispute over grazing lands in the area. Tensions run high around the settlement.
27 June. SNAF forces kill four al Shabaab fighters during clashes near Buulo Sheekh. The chain of events that led to the skirmish is unknown.
27 June. Armed clashes erupt between SNAF forces and al Shabaab fighters near Madow settlement. The resulting casualty figures and chain of events that led to the skirmish are unknown.

27 June. Erigavo residents demonstrated against the Rahanweyn traders (Rahanweyn are People from South West of Somalia namely Baidoa and Hudur) that occupy the strategic business centres in Erigavo town. They appealed to SL government to deport Rahanweyn traders from Erigavo (Back to Somalia) as they are not Somalilanders.

27 June. Southwest Special Police Forces (SWSPF) reportedly shot and killed a minibus driver at Bulo Addoy village (approx. 22kms S of Qansax-Dheere district). The SWSPF were in a security operation during the incident, and reportedly had instructed drivers to avoid using this road earlier. The motive behind the killing is unclear yet.
27 June. A roadside IED targets a SNAF foot patrol in Baraawe.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 27 June. Puntland and Somaliland forces reportedly exchanged artillery fire in God-Qaboobe during the afternoon.

27 June. Al Shabaab media reports an IED explosion targeting Somali and US trained Bancroft mercenaries caused fatalities. The source claims 11 Bancroft soldiers dead as well as 'other soldiers.' (estimated total of 21 fatalities)

27 June. Reports indicate that an unidentified gunman armed with a pistol reportedly shot and killed a Police Officer while on duty at the Siinaay junction road vicinity, in Bondheere District. The perpetrators seized an AK 47 belonging to the victim and managed to flee the scene. District Police visited the scene and conducted security operations to no avail.
27 June. Unidentified gunmen assassinate a businessman near Sinai Junction. The assailants escaped. The motives behind the killing are unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 27 June. Sporadic exchanges of fire between Puntland and Somaliland forces at Tuko Raq on the night of June 26-27. Locals report 'full scale clashes.'

27 June. Unidentified gunmen attempt to assassinate Somali journalist Farhiyo Mohamud Mire near Dabka Junction. The assailants escaped the scene. The victim survived. The motives behind the incident are unknown.

27 June. The Somali National Army has conducted a planned operation in Jilib town [southern Somalia] attacking a house where more than 30 foreign al-Shabab terrorists were living in killing all. Information from the national security agency says that most of the foreign fighters killed are Kenyan and Sudanese nationals. The operation is beloved to have been launched to target Bashir Qorgab, a senior Al-Shabab figure with $5m bounty on his head.

26 June 2018: Two Somali soldiers were killed when their car ran over an improvised explosive device (IED) claimed by Al Shabaab which was targeted at the Somali security forces at Il-baq village, outside of Balad town which is about 30 KM away north of Mogadishu.

26 June. Reports indicated that an RCIED targeting an SNA Vehicle Convoy from Afgoye and heading towards Wanlaweyne detonated in the vicinity of Warmahan village (approx. 22km North West of Afgoye), Afgoye District. The device hit and damaged one SNA battlewagon. Three SNA soldiers were killed including a senior officer. SNA soldiers reacted with gunfire in the suspected direction where they believed the attackers were hiding. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

26 June. Suspected al Shabaab fighters shot and killed two Southwest State Special Police forces (SWSPF) in Berdaale town (approx. 56kms NW of Baidoa town). The two soldiers were heading to their residence during the attack. The perpetrators took the rifle of the victims and managed to escape from the scene.
26 June. Unidentified gunmen assassinate two Southwest soldiers in Baidoa. The assailants escaped. The motives behind the incident are unknown.

26 June. An RCIED targeting an SNA convoy travelling near Shalamboot town heading towards El-jaale in Merka district detonated. Sources said that the blast reportedly hit one SNA truck. At least one SNA soldier was injured in the incident. Al Shabaab fighters claimed the responsibility.

actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: On 26 June 2018, Somaliland forces clashed with Puntland forces after the deployment of Puntland troops and hardware to Tuka-raq village (Laas Caanood, Sool).
26 June. The Islamic State's Amaq News Agency claimed responsibility for the alleged killing of a SNPF officer in Mogadishu. The incident and its exact location within the city are not known.

26 June. Reports indicate that an unidentified gunman armed with a pistol reportedly shot and killed a well-known Clan elder namely Abdi Ulusow while exiting the local Mosque at the conclusion of evening prayer in Suuqa- Yaraha vicinity, in Hamarjajab District. Reliable sources stated that the victim was an electoral delegate who participated in the local elections in Hirshabelle state. The Perpetrators managed to escape. No comment from District Officials regarding the incident.
26 June. Local civilians protest against Rahanweyn traders operating in Ceerigaabo and ask Somalilander authorities to deport them due to their status as 'non-Somalilander'.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 25 June. Reports indicated that an RCIED targeting an AMISOM Convoy travelling from Balcad to Jowhar town detonated on the outskirt of Gololey village, Balcad District. At least two AMISOM soldiers were killed while two others were injured. The explosion also damaged an AMISOM APC. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

25 June. Reports indicated that an RCIED targeting a Senior SNA officer and his security detail travelling from Mogadishu to Jowhar town, detonated at Qalimow village, in Balcad District. The blast reportedly killed two SNA soldiers while three others were seriously injured. SNA soldiers reacted with gunfire in the general direction where the alleged attackers were believed to be hiding. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

Non-violent activity: 25 June. Al Shabaab leader Ahmed Diriye also known as Abu Ubeidah has reportedly died of cancer in Jilib town on 25 June. Al Shabaab denies this, claiming the leader is alive and healthy.
25 June. Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate two Southwest Special Police Force officers in Berdale. The assailants escaped the scene with confiscated weaponry.
25 June. An al Shabaab IED targets soldiers outside of Shalambood. One injury.
25 June. Five travellers are killed outside of Warshiikh by unidentified gunmen.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 24 June. Puntland forces fire several mortar rounds towards Somaliland positions near Tukaraq. Somaliland forces reply with counter battery fire. No casualties reported.
24 June. 5 al Shabaab and one civilian dead during clashes with government forces in Qoryooley.

24 June. Somali army attack and overtake an al Shabaab position north of Kismayo known at Arare Bridge (unknown location; possibly spanning the Webi Jubba River; coordinated approx). 7 al Shabaab dead.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 23 June. A 15 minutes exchange of gunfire between AMISOM/SNA troops and a group of suspected al Shabaab fighters was reported at Embareeso village located 5km North of Afgoye district. The attack began with mortar shells fire towards AMISOM SNA bases followed by light gunfire which ensued for about 15 minutes after which suspected al Shabaab militants withdrew.
23 June. Gunmen loyal to Puntland attack two Somaliland Police stations in Laascaanood. Sool Governor supporting Puntland announces inmates were released during the operation. Casualties unknown.

23 June. Two women were shot and killed after unidentified armed man gun fired at the front of their residence near Kulmiye Hotel in Garsoor village. The motive behind the shooting is unknown. Puntland police are investigating the incident.

23 June. Unconfirmed reports stated that at least three (3) suspected 60 mm mortar rounds launched from unknown direction landed in multiple locations inside of Howlwadag and Wardhigley Districts respectively. The devices landed in an empty place, no casualties were reported. Perpetrators, who remained unidentified by the source, managed to escape.
23 June. A Wagardhac/Marehan civilian was killed by Suleiman/Habargidir gunmen in Balli Cad. The assailants escaped. The incident is linked to clan-revenge.

23 June. Unconfirmed reports stated that at least three (3) suspected 60 mm mortar rounds launched from unknown direction landed in multiple locations inside of Howlwadag and Wardhigley Districts respectively. The devices landed in an empty place, no casualties were reported. Perpetrators, who remained unidentified by the source, managed to escape.

23 June. A UVIED attached to a private vehicle owned by a government SNA official soldier detonated near the Hanti-Wadaag village neighbourhood, in Waberi district. The target person survived the explosion. No civilian casualties were reported. Government soldiers arrived on the scene and conducted a search operation, however no arrests were reported.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 22 June. Reports stated that a RCIED buried along the roadside targeted AMISOM forces (consist of 9 battle wagons) at the Warmahan village neighbourhood, Afgoye District. After RCIED blast, al Shabaab engaged the forces in a well-organized direct ambush attack against Convoy which began with rocket propelled grenades (RPGs) followed by heavy gunfire which lasted about one hour after which al Shabaab militants withdrew. Two Vehicles were destroyed by IED explosion and RPG fired by al Shabaab militants. At least 11 people including soldiers and al Shabaab were killed in the fight.

22 June. Reports stated that the government soldiers reportedly shot and killed an unidentified militiaman and injured another one in Xawadley village approximately 24 Kms NE of Balcad District. This shooting came after the militants attempted to open the river edge flood bridge which was closed with sack and stones by the residence people and Government as to protect extra floods. Three others were captured and arrested by Hirshabelle forces.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 22 June. UPDF forces fire several mortar rounds towards a group of al Shabaab fighters 3km north of FOB Embresso. Outcome and resulting casualty figures unknown.

22 June. Suspected al Shabaab assailant hurls a hand grenade towards a MoSF checkpoint in Hawl Wadaag. One MoSF soldier and two civilian bystanders were injured by the blast. The perpetrator escaped the scene.

22 June. Reports stated that a hand grenade was hurled at SNA checkpoint near the District Commissioner's Office neighbourhood, in Waberi District. Soldiers reacted with gunfire in the direction believed to be where the perpetrators were hiding. One person was injured by the blast. Government soldiers conducted security search operation of this incident and arrested several suspects.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
notes: 21 June. Jubaland forces who were on foot security patrol clashed with al Shabaab fighters near Jubaland/Somali base at Sunguuni village (42km North East of Kismayo town). Four al Shabaab fighters and one Jubbland soldier were reportedly killed and others injured as the result of heavy gunfire exchange. The injured soldier was taken to Kismayo for treatment.

21 June. Information indicates that suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed a civilian Toyota transporting (Khad/Mira) from Hagardera Kenya to Hoosingo village at approx. 09km west of the village and (c.75kms SE of Dhobley town). The driver of the vehicle was reportedly killed in the attack while the second driver managed to escape the vehicle with the goods from the incident location.

21 June. Report indicates that a Kenyan warplane conducted an airstrike against an al Shabaab position at Tima Cade grazing area (approx. 25km S of Burdhubo district). According to the information, the warplane targeted al Shabaab hideouts.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Puntland Security Force
notes: 21 June. Puntland and Somaliland forces exchange artillery fire at Tuko Raq. No causalities.
21 June. Suspected al Shabaab fighters fire three 60mm mortar rounds towards the Parliament building. The rounds land 150-200m from the building. No casualties reported.

Looting: 20 June. South West Special Police Forces (SWSPF) launched a security operation at Buur Midow village (approx. 40kms SE of Dinsoor district). During the operation, SWSPF allegedly broke doors of several shops in the village and took some items. The shops were reportedly owned by al Shabaab, no confrontation was reported from the village during the operation.
20 June. Two unidentified clans clash in the outskirts of Muqakoori. The exact location of the skirmish and resulting casualty figures are unknown.

20 June. South West Special Police Forces (SWSPF) shot and killed three al Shabaab suspects driving a motorbike near Qod Qod village (approx. 30kms SE of Dinsoor district). The SWSPF were in a security operation and heading back to their base in Dinsoor district during the incident. No casualty was reported from SWSPF.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 20 June. Reports state that a RCIED targeting AMISOM supply convoy from Mogadishu heading to Jowhar town detonated at the Eggero settlement between Gololey and Garsaale village under Balcad District (Middle Shabelle region) followed by gunfire. One vehicle was reportedly damaged. One soldier was reported injured by the blast.

20 June. A Khat dealer was shot and injured after a dispute to pay taxes at the check near the Greenline between North and South Galkayo. The customs police seized the Mira Khat that trafficker attempted to smuggle without payment the legal duty. The injured person was taken to hospital for treatment and PL police are investigating the incident.

20 June. Local police forces in a security patrol shot and killed a man and injured two others in Adaado section of Berdale neighbourhood. The security forces reportedly suspected the man and opened fire at him. No further casualty reported form the incident. The police commissioner reportedly ordered the arrest of the men that perpetrated this crime.

20 June. A hand grenade was hurled at SNA checkpoint near Ex. Control vicinity, in Dayniile District. Soldiers reacted with gunfire in general direction believed to be where the perpetrator(s) was hiding. Perpetrators not known.
20 June. Suspected al Shabaab detonates an explosive under the car of two students in Hodan district. One injury reported.
19 June. Report stated that the dead body of a young man with knife wounds was found in his home at the Livestock Market area, Heliwa District. The motive for his death is unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 19 June. Reports stated that a NISA soldier shot and killed a traffic police officer at the Jiradda Taleex (Talex Allay) vicinity, in Hodan District.
